Reviews.Title: “For fun maybe, for sleep, NO.”
Reviews.Author: aknoble
Reviews.Content: I made the unfortunate mistake of staying here on a business trip...and had already had one sleepless night on this particular trip in another hotel in another town and had to be up and ready to go at 5 am, so I was tired and I needed sleep. Unfortunately, this seems to be the party hotel for the locals. There was a bachelor party or something involving girls coming and going all night in the room next to me and unfortunately they went to bed about the time I had to be out. The walls are paper thin...I could seriously hear their conversations through the pillows and the wall. It felt a little sketchy. I also had to choose what to leave plugged in so I could charge my cell phone and use it as my alarm...which meant the phone was unplugged and I didn't want to fumble with it to call the front desk at 2 am. Why is it so hard to get outlets by the bed at hotels?!?! Anyway,the people at check in were very nice and the decor is fun and trendy and the pool area looks like fun in the summer, but I don't care how cheap it is, I will never stay there on business again. It is nice that it doesn't have a casino and the hotel itself is a bit quieter than any of the places on the strip, but at least even the noisiest hotels on the strip have soundproofing so the rooms are quiet. I might stay here for a cheap weekend getaway for fun, but I think I would prefer an older outdated place on the strip for the same price if it meant I could get a little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: NJGIANTSFAN
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our wedding weekend as it was a hotel off the strip and did not have a casino. Hotel staff,particularly Britney at the reception desk were wonderful. Allowed us to take pictures in the lobby with a large party as well as pulling two very large limos into their very small parking lot.All of our guests stayed at the hotel and enjoyed as well Room faced the pool and had a balcony and a soaking tub. Very Nice. we experienced no issues as other folks have stated with loud pool music at night nor did airplane noise keep us up. Hotel has a very small but cozy bar and a small and cozy restaurant. We did have lunch and the food was good and very reasonable in price. The hotel is a little ways away from the strip and will take 15 or so minutes to walk to. Otherwise a cab is about 8 bucks. If you dont want to go that far, Hard Rock across the street has casino,restaurant and spa. The hotel does have a policy against outside food or drink but the policy is not really enforced as it seemed most guests had at least drinks in their room. Thanks to The Rumor for making the hotel portion of our wedding very easy. WE WILL BE BACK!!!! Dave and Mindy

Reviews.Title: “Kitchy Kool”
Reviews.Author: DRS_CA
Reviews.Content: Rumor Hotel has much to recommend it. It is a new, two-story, non-casino, suite-style hotel, whose rooms look out on a curvy pool surrounded by palms and scattered cabanas. Its off the strip location, across from the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, makes for a calmer stay but with throbbing action a short walk away. For an $8.00 fee you can also visit the extremely well equipped Hard Rock fitness center. The look of the lobby and rooms is "Euro-kitch-Phillippe-Stark-gone-amuck," but the rooms are very large, comfortable, quiet and well furnished. Like many Las Vegas hotels, rooms at Rumor can often be a very good value. If you don't mind a several block walk to thke strip, Rumor is a good alternative to the chaos of a casino stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid E
Reviews.Content: Pros --nice lobby and great shower. Cons--my hotel room door stuck, no washcloths were available, charged a resort fee but never told what it covered, no coffee maker, no room service, no hotel guide, took 30 minutes for them to replace the broken iron, and worse of all...the bathroom smelled like asparagus.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesandStephan... S
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty much as advertised. The rooms were nice size and very comfortable. The areas around the hotel (lobby, pool, landscaping) were all kept very clean and nice. We stayed for a week and got a pretty good deal price wise. It's only about 1 mile from the strip so not a ton of foot traffic. The hotel was very pet friendly but you wouldn't have known it until Thursday Yappy Hour. The only complaints are that there was not fridge in the room, the rooms are poorly lit and the soaking tub takes forever to fill up.

Reviews.Title: “The Epitome of False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: S_Eeyore84
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to pay a lot of money for an image, this is your place. If you want the service and amenities associated with $135 per night hotel, you would be better off spending your money elsewhere. The rooms in this hotel are not put together well and the manager "Lana" does nothing to accommodate. Shaw, the other manager is much better. The general staff on the other hand is pleasant, however uninformed. The hotel advertises iPod docks, elevated soaking tubs, refrigerators upon request, custom beds, and room service among other amenities. The duvet cover is made of two sheets folded over on each other, which is peculiar considering the bed itself only has a sheet on the mattress but not one to cover up with. There are not iPod docks in every room as advertised, the room service came in to go boxes with plastic silverware and unbuttered toast (none in the box either) after elevating the prices, charging an automatic 20% gratuity and $3 deliver charge. The ice that comes out of the ice machine (not located in every building or floor) has black specks of mold in it. The first room I was in had broken furniture and no tub (as requested) so I moved. The second room had no nightstand, so I used the chair. I requested an iPod dock several times upon check in and did not receive it. I got one the next day from the general manager Shaw, only to be informed by the other manager "Lana" that now another guest isn't going to have an iPod dock because they had to give it to me. My husband had to request batteries for the remote on the heater and the "no longer give out refrigerators", so it was suggested we put ice in our sink. The good things about this place are that the valet staff (all of them), bartenders (mike and mark), security staff, housekeepers (Briunna and Shirley) and servers are great! The restaurant has good food (from what I ordered), the pillowsgood are soft, and the pool has a few relaxing hammocks to lay in. After speaking with Shaw I felt confident that my stay would improve and be worth it so I extended for another night. That was a mistake on my part. Had I paid $60-75 a night I would have nothing to complain about, but charging $135 a night OFF THE STRIP and coming upto this short is unacceptable. If the management would hire more employees and spend the money to keep up the property as advertised I would not hesitate to spend $135 a night in the future. As it is right now, I would only recommend the bar and restaurant. Come visit, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly??????”
Reviews.Author: carla s
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Agoda . The price was very good till we got to the Hotel.For sure is pet friendly at a cost . $25 .00.x pet Then one other charge was added $13.60 for resort fees.Those charges are not disclouse anywhere. Carla

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kmiller206
Reviews.Content: I am a certified hotel snob and this place was great on every level. I booked this for a friend’s bachelorette party and it had the perfect vibe for it. The rooms were fantastic; the service friendly without a bit of pretense and the most surprising part was the food! We ate there twice and it what shockingly good. Happy hour pricing was great. I felt like I was stealing it because the prices were so low and the quality was so high. Get the short rib sliders for breakfast. I wish I was eating one right now. My whole group was locals and we plan to go back just to eat. It was also great to be able to park near the room, no 10 minute walk to your room like at a casino. The pool was also great even though it was a little chilly. My friends still laid out most of the day. The only negative was that the sink had really high pressure and the bowl was oddly shaped. This combo made water spray everywhere if you didn't turn it on slowly. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to everyone, it is meant to be cool and some people (like my parents) wouldn’t feel comfortable. But for anyone who is into the vibe, it couldn’t be better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: alexmeow
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and the bed was very soft, the best night sleep that I have ever had at a hotel. The room looked exactly the same as the images online. Our room had a balcony that over looked the street, which was perfect for relaxing after a night out. The rain shower is amazing! Room service prices for drinks were insane!!! You are much better off walking to the liquor store that is in the next parking lot and buying your own. That being said, they do try and stop you from bring in outside drinks or food but you can easily get around that by putting it in another bag. The ice machines are hard to find and some were not working but with the liquor store next door and $2 bags of ice its not that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Sexy”
Reviews.Author: DrGrapes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here sort of on a whim just to check it out. I liked the whole boutique / laid back style. I was here in January so it was off season for the pool area but the hotel was great. It's totally non-Vegas as far as size and style goes and there are very few amenities but I loved my stay. I had a regular room which I considered very adequate. The furniture was sleek and sexy though the view out the window left a little to be desired. Pool views are much more fun. The staff was very hospitable and friendly. The bar area is super cool. Food options are limited but there are so many great places to eat in Vegas who cares. It is NOT convenient to the strip if that's a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Good...but”
Reviews.Author: sarah0949
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once in the past, it was an out of the ordinary stay for me because I usually pick one of the station casinos, but they were all booked that weekend. I loved the vibe of this hotel as well as the friendliness of the staff. Our rooms however, were not as clean as I would have hoped. I am a stickler for cleanliness so Im not sure if I should grade off the curve or by my expectations. I used to clean hotels when I was in school and I always made sure to vacuum well and lysol the floor as well as the shower curtains and door knobs. This adds an extra touch of cleanliness to a room and doesnt take much extra time. I now travel with a bottle of my own lysol spray which I did use when I arrived to my room. If it had been cleaner, and maybe a bit quieter too (I agree that you hear almost everything) then this would get a five star from me. Im looking to travel to vegas tomorrow night for a one night stay and maybe I will give this hotel another chance since my other favorites have no vacancy.

Reviews.Title: “Service was first class!”
Reviews.Author: BabsThePanda
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit here for meals and drinks as we had a concert booked at the Hard Rock. The service we recieved was excellent. The waiter had the barman make me a special cocktail that I would normally have at home and the food came promptly and was very tasty. The waiter was also helpful enough to provide us with a recommendation for some where we could view the UFC the following evening. The place they recommended was amazing and made for one of the best nights of our stay. Cant thank them enough for being some helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaK33
Reviews.Content: Being that I once lived in Vegas and I know the mark up, plus I would rather tip the locals well in the industry than pay the pockets of the franchises...This hotel is safe, comfortable and hip! I am a well traveled woman with fine taste and I would recommend it to other traveling women!

Reviews.Title: “There is something strange about this place...”
Reviews.Author: jgr83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. The pool area looks nice. Stay away from rooms near the ice machine. The AC is extremely loud. A lot of couples seem to be "swinging by" if you know what I mean. A man knocked on my door at 4.30 in the morning. He did the same at my friend's room, which was two buildings away, not sure what he was looking for...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: margaretchantel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago - sorry for the late review. I loved this place. I loved the location, and the size of the hotel. It was beautifully decorated. The staff were great with the exception with one person (she was kind of a know-it-all and I could tell she kind of drove her coworkers a little crazy) but other than her, I enjoyed my stay here. I would definitely return. If you are looking for a place that's smaller, the employees know you and are very friendly - I would highly recommend it. The food was excellent. I'm the type of person who prefers staying off the strip as it takes forever to trek to get something on the strip and there's always line-ups for things... At Rumor, there was a CVS store close by, as well as various restaurants etc. I was able to walk to Planet Hollywood and it took about 10 minutes... A cab didn't cost that much either... I'm returning to LV in a few weeks - and my boyfriend wanted to stay DT - I would totally stay here again if it was my choice (this time it isn't :( )

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: keketravel
Reviews.Content: It's better than expected. They renovated the hotel and now it is modern and fancy. Great for girls trip, couples, friends, and solo. Just one or two blocks away from Planet Hollywood/Strip. So it's not too bad and especially when you have a car with you. Parking spot is limited I think there are about 15 self-parking spots. If you can't find one, you will have to take their hotel valet parking. It's included but you have to pay the tips for the guy. The room is not bad, everything is new and the shower room is new too. Enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be spreading rumors!”
Reviews.Author: TheAdventuress
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price for Vegas, and I love the decor. It was best described as a 60s/70s Italian futuro moderno B-movie set and then add sexy to it. Everyone was friendly. The manager was very generous when they didn't have the original room I had reserved. Addiction restaurant had the cheapest meals too, and they were a bit slow, but good. If you're some boring, conservative, religious, Republican, you might want to stay somewhere else, because this place is "swingin'". My only complaints, no soap dish, and no shuttle service. But bus 108 takes you to the airport and 202? takes you straight to the strip, and if you want to fork over cab cash, then you won't have any issues. P.S. Don't eat at the Indian Restaurant nearby, ridiculously over priced. Take the bus to Grand Lux Cafe and have lots of food and drinks for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “RUMOR has it!”
Reviews.Author: hkosovich
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nites on business. The pictures on RUMOR's site are all accurate. They did not tell me of resort fee so ASK if they don't tell you. it provides free parking, free wireless internet and 2 bottles of water in room. LOCATION: right across from Hard Rock so the fun is 24/7. Cab ride away from PF changs or Gordon Biersch. CVS, Ferraro's, hoffbrau house, convenience store,SUBWAY, and fluff & fold walking distance CASINO: This hotel does not have a casino so great if you want CALM however has few machines embedded in bar. BATHROOM: Free shampoo, condition, body lotion from www.bodyeclipse.com. if you are missing anything, just ask staff and they will deliver. They are replaced daily. Standup shower in bathroom, tub IN room, yes IN room. Bathroom COM: HIGH water pressure in sink that water splattered all over me. just be very careful. BED: comfy and linens soft. Similar to W TV: flat panel Haier Overall great stay but one major con the hotel cannot control is you can hear every plane that takes off overhead.... oh well. Still <3 the RUMOR. definitely going back

Reviews.Title: “Good option off the strip”
Reviews.Author: nostalgia88
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place to stay! Sure, it's not on the strip, but I'm past the point where I need to be in the middle of all that madness. When you're in super high heels, even walking across the street is a daunting task. So if you're going to cab it anyway, you might as well save some money and stay at Rumor. First of all, I love how short the taxi ride is from McCarran here. It's like $13 including tip, and I think my cab driver still took me slightly out of the way. The bad news is, it's really close to the airport. The air traffic noise can be deafening. That is probably my biggest complaint. My next biggest complaint is that not all of the rooms come with the huge soaker tubs that are highlighted on their website. Not a huge deal, but if you book a room looking for one of these, keep in mind that you will need to request it. Here's a breakdown of the stuff that's important to me, and how Rumor fared: Water pressure: 5 stars Water hardness: 2 stars Sink area for spreading out my stuff: 3 stars Towel softness: 3 stars Sheet softness and overall bed comfort: 4 stars Smelly hotel air factor: 4 stars (including 1 star for windows that open) Climate control: 2 stars (swamp cooler thing was loud and sort of obnoxious, and ideal temp was hard to reach) Bathroom amenities: 3 stars (why does everyone have a better hair dryer than me??) One thing I will note, is that while the sinks are the stylish bowl-type with fancy hardware, the water pressure is nothing short of AGGRESSIVE and will leave you with a wet floor if you turn it on too fast. Great value for the money, good service, and although cabs don't come by very often, the guys at the valet counter are more than happy to flag one down for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to escape the Strip. But Style Over Substance”
Reviews.Author: KandyKorn143
Reviews.Content: Beware the hidden resort fees to pay at the end of your stay! The Rumor is in a perfect location with everything you need on your doorstep; the strip, shops, CVS, casinos, Hofberhaus, etc. However, the rooms are all identical, so no character and if you have a room with an adjoining door MOVE! We were forced to relocate in the middle of the night because the noisy neighbors sounded like they were sitting on our bed. Another note, the rain showers are amazing, but after a hard day pounding the strip in heels you may want to soak your feet and you can't. Also, they offer no anti-bacterial soap in the rooms. Only a Shea-butter face bar. If you're touching slot machines all day you need to disinfect. They have no business center either, which, I know is lame, but if you have boarding passes to print out it's helpful. We were on our Honeymoon and were offered no additional upgrades or services (free or otherwise) which is strange for Vegas. The restaurant Addiction was also sub-standard. We may stay again, but it's overpriced and thinks it's better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with character”
Reviews.Author: 6timestripstime
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights over New Years. We had a beautiful room with a tub facing the inside of the complex (however this you have to request upon booking as they only have a few of those available). We didn't use much of their ammenities offered, only went to the restaurant once on New Years day. The service and the food was not very exciting (especially compare to the prices) and we had to wait a very long time for it. We were pretty relaxed, so we didn't say anything, but under normal circumstances would probably not have paid for it. The prices for the in-room bar/ drinks are pretty high, so you might want to consider drinking outside and come home without wanting some more (including water). We didn't use the pool as the temperatures did not allow it, but it looked very nice and the lounge chairs & cabanas looked very comfortable. The amenities were very nice, but placed sparingly so make sure you bring everything you need. Housekeeping was good and prompt. Overall it was a lovely place and we consider coming back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad service”
Reviews.Author: alibabnet
Reviews.Content: I'm not great at writing reviews, so I'll just share experiences as they came: ARRIVAL & REGISTRATION: The valet parking was nice and available (Free valet parking for guests) Registration was quick. Free fast wifi everywhere in the hotel. ROOM: Our room was pretty nice, very stylish. Big tub inside the room with a mirror, pretty cool after a long walk from the strip to the hotel at night (I'll talk location later). We were 1st floor with a parking lot view, so essentially the shades were closed almost the all time we were in the room. The room was super quiet, great sound isolation, barely no noise from outside. LCD screen, cool bathroom. No mini bar. Room cleaning was average. When we got back in the room at night, the shirt I had left on the sofa was on the floor. The glass of champ... bad sparkling wine we did not finish remained seating by the tub untouched. The water bottles were not replaced, nor were the bathroom shampoo and shower gel. THE RESTAURANT We had both dinner on NYE and breakfast brunch on the 1st in the morning. For both, they had the same menu they offer on other days. Dinner was delicious. The kobe sliders were amazing! 1st bad surprise: the champagne ($8 a glasse) is not actual champagne, it's just some average (bad) sparkling wine. Ask for Freixenet, much better. Other than this, it was a great dinner. Breakfast was a totally different story. We had breakfast outside by the poolside, which was super nice in the sun. We both ordered eggs and sausages. The wait was very long (40 min?) I asked for sparkling water. The waiter comes back after 5 minutes saying "we don't have sparkling water". Really??? The waiter was pretty bad, although a nice guy. Mistakes, forgot twice the water glasses we ordered... LOCATION: This is an off-strip hotel. The walk to the strip (angle ph Towers) is a solid 15-20 minutes, which is no fun. Cab ride to the strip is approx $10-12. OVERALL Overall I would say you can stay here if you can get a good deal and have a car to go around. If you find similar deals with other hotels, and don't care about the particular "stylish boutique" aspect of the Rumor, I would consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hip clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickfamily
Reviews.Content: The decor was modern and fun. The patio and pool area was large and amazing! We did not use the pool since its December but we would love to come back in the summertime and party by the pool or lounge outside with drinks. We love the layout of the hotel and our room was very spacious with a modern bathroom. Our room even had a tub in the room with a large wall mirror :) it is a fun, young, hip place. We did not eat at Addiction the restaurant at the hotel. We walked over to the hard rock casino which I is right across the street. It was a great hotel with good location and vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not on the strip but it was very convenience. I like it because it was not that noisy but it is very close to the strip. The front desk people was very helpful and valet was good too:) The restaurant was small but very unique. I love the Chinese chicken salad - yummy :) The bar was really good and love our special drinks from the bar. Overall, love it !!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class service!”
Reviews.Author: Aristacah
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT A FAMILY HOTEL. DON'T BRING YOUR CHILDREN HERE. We stayed at Rumor for Christmas and really loved it. This is an adult hotel. It is not for kids. If you have children, stay at a place where they have things to do. Small dogs are welcome and they have a monthly "Yappy Hour", which according to the staff, is very funny and fun. The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are comfortable. The tubs and showers are nice but I would have liked another nozzle on the shower, not just a rain shower head. The rooms are fairly large and they are comfortable. The staff is first class and they treat you like royalty. Trevin, the bartender is entertaining, informative and just plain fun. The Chef and servers are very accommodating and go out of their way to ensure you are happy. The food at Addiction is very good. Try the fried Nutter Butter! If you want casino action, it is a short walk across the street to the Hard Rock Hotel. We had a great time there, also. This was a very pleasant experience and one we will repeat several times this year. We love Las Vegas and Rumor Hotel fits the bill for relaxation and romance!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas....Love the Rumor”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelChick1
Reviews.Content: Although I'm a retired travel professional,I have always taken pride in the places that I recommend not just because of the diamond rating but,how the customer is treated which by far is the most important. The Rumor is a little secret, that no one seems to know about directly across the street from the Hard Rock. If you are looking for something nice,quiet,clean, and relaxing this is your place. It's a short drive over to the strip,walking distance to a little strip mall with CVS,johnny rockets...etc and close to nice restaurants. Lawry's is over on the next block. The rooms are spacious with balconies and to top it off the rooms have showers and this huge jacuzzi tub. Please note that I do not work for this hotel but the service I received from the time I checked in (Thanks Chrystal) was great. I had a problem and my room had to be changed at 2:00 am and the night staff ( Thanks DaNiva, Willie, and Andy) was extremely accommodating. I lost my charger to my phone and the head of housekeeping(Thanks Linda) assisted me in finding it(Too many lemon drop martinis). (Thanks Dana for the parking information!!!) I can say that I don't have to stay at the Signature, Palms Place, or the Hotel , when there is a Gem like this in town take advantage!!! Trust me you won't be disappointed. If you have a small pet there is a little dog park on the grounds and you can walk your dog in the morning before you head off on business or to the Strip. Shaw Thanks for making my stay in Las Vegas one of the coolest in a long time. I will be back in a couple of months. Thanks Christmas Guest in 2004

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Janice2983
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at a hotel on the strip, but this trip we wanted to try something different. My friend has previously stayed here, and had good things to say so I we gave it a try. The rooms were exactly pictured as they are on their site. I really liked the decor and modern look Rumor had. Check-in was fast and with no problem. Our room was clean, except our bathroom. The room was spotless, however it seemed they did a quick clean up with the bathroom. Not horribly dirty, but it could of been cleaned better. The downside to this hotel is it's not walking distance to the strip. A quick taxi ride will get you there. The valet worker did awesome job waving down a taxi for us, minus the chaos of traffic coming from across the street (Hard Rock) due to a concert. I like having no casino in the hotel. I'm useto staying at a hotel with a casino, but I enjoyed the quite hotel and not smelling smoke from people smoking. I enjoyed our stay at Rumor and we got a great deal for our room. I would recommend this hotel to others if you want a quite hotel and don't mind taking a taxi to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL--everything you need for Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Rod M
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. The rooms were spacious and had very modern decor. The pool area was gorgeous and although it was too cold to do any poolside activities (I was there just before Christmas, 2011) I want to come back so I do some lounging poolside. I have no complaints at all and will definitely come to this hotel the next time I'm in Vegas. Also, it's right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, but close enough to the strip that if you wanted to get there it's a very short cab ride or drive. So we were able to get away from the crowds on the strip and enjoy the laid-back boutique atmoshere, but could easily go party with the crowd if we wanted. GREAT HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Next time, we're staying longer.”
Reviews.Author: Phenocia B
Reviews.Content: So, my boyfriend and I looked in to staying here a couple months ago, and made the (poor) choice of staying here because of some so-so reviews right around that time. This time, we decided to stay here one night of our three night stay and finally give it a try. I was not expecting a lot because there had been some reviews about the rooms not being clean, and generally, it not being a great stay. This was not the case. Upon check in, we were greeted pleasantly by the desk attendant - we checked in after 4 - the stated check in time - but had called much earlier to see if we could check in earlier due to my meltdown over another hotel having only scalding water and not being able to shower. They said no problem - which immediately made the day better. Our room was clean and large, the bed was very comfortable, and in general, I found it a very nice surprise. I want the pillows from this hotel. they were amazing. I slept like a baby. My boyfriend did not. Unfortunately, there was a very very loud birthday party going on in the room next door to us, and despite being asked multiple times to quiet down, my boyfriend still put in a call after 2 to complain - eventually, they quieted down and went to sleep. I kind of wanted to try the restaurant Addiction, but since there was no menu or hours, and the hotel lobby was very quiet on a Sunday night, we opted to go across the street to the Hard Rock's Pink Taco - which was good for a late night bite, but I'm still curious about Addiction. The tub was great, I stopped at LUSH at Mandalay Bay and got a bubble bar, you can rotate the TV, so it was very relaxing. We had opted to stay on Freemont street the previous two nights, as we like a hotel down there and aren't huge on the strip. However, this was WAY bigger, and the room was nicer. Overall, we agreed we will give RUMOR another try next time - and maybe the balcony room that we request won't be facing the street. Aside from the noise, and the lack of info about the hotel, I don't have anything negative to say about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: CEPPaulT
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on December 9, 2011. Easy to find across from Hard Rock. Parking lot not the greatest - then again, if one is visiting Las Vegas, use Valet. Pleasant reception with quick check-in. Area felt safe and quite secure (not an excuse to lose situational awareness).Room was clean. Unexpectedly nice, however, the decor is simply not my cup of tea. I was not there for any other reason than to be up early for a flight out of McCarran, thus I cannot provide a rating of much else. I used no other services other than the bar for a shot of whisky. Knowing tastes of friends that would consider this an alternative place to stay in Las Vegas, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Secret.”
Reviews.Author: Ballerina702
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rumor over the weekend. Over all we had a great experience. I'd love to give it a 5 stars, but there are few things I'd like to see the improvement. -Check In: Check in was a breeze! Unlike bigger resort, there was no long queue at the reception. 'Niki' was very professional, she had the paper work and keys ready for us. -Room: Very nice decors and we loved the bathtub. However, the lack refrigerator and small closet space were a bit of a disappointment. We didn't care much about the bed neither, it was too soft and provided no support. -Room Service: We ordered breakfast from 'Addiction'. The food was average. But, I'm sure it could have been better if we dined in person. -Resort Fees: This is a Winter and the pool was closed! $11.99 per night can really add up and we didn't even use the internet. They should consider waiving the fees during the off season. The hotel is across from the Hard Rock and close to the Strip. Getting to and from the airport was very easy, it was only minutes away. We loved the ambiance of our room and the reception area. Valet parking only. And, if you need a cab; they'll flag one for you. That was a nice touch. We'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms........BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Ron G
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at Rumors. I will say that the rooms were good despite the bad view of the parking lot. One thing to watch out for is the bathtub. I saw the website and was excited to take a soak in the tub but when I read the small print on the site it said only in select rooms. Apparently they don't have very many, it's really just for show. Now where I would give this place a ZERO is service. Instead of describing it to you. I'm going to just give you the experiences I had at Rumors and you be the judge. (CHECK IN ) When I first arrived I got to the hotel early. I entered and was greeted at the front desk. I explained I wanted to make sure I had the bathtub in my room. She said "sure, we will be able to accommodate you but check in is not until 4pm. The room you requested is not ready" Now I will give a pass on this because I came earlier then the check in time, but the place was dead. No one was in the lobby. The staff were just talking on cellphones or to one another. I couldn't have seen more than 5 guest my entire stay. Either way I let it go and waited. (ROOM SERVICE) One of the great things about staying in a hotel is room service. After hearing how good the food was I ordered some. They tack on all these additional fee's including 20 percent gratuity and $3 service fee in the bill but lots of places do that. Yet you would think with all these fee's your food would come on a plate. Well I guess the hotel did not want to spend the money. The meal is delivered doggy style. (heheheh) Get your heads out the gutter. I mean in a doggy box and to top it off my cocktail came in a plastic cup complete with straw. I'm sorry but can we say "ghetto". It's not Mcdonald's it's room service that I'm paying out the butt for. So although the food was good. It really felt weird eating from a box with plastic forks and knives. Despite this I was feeling lazy in the morning so ordered breakfast in the room. When I called from my cell phone because the hotel phone was not working. I was told the restaurant is too busy and to call back. So came down a few hours later for breakfast at the restaurant what was the point of ordering in now. (RESTAURANT ADDICTION) So when I arrived it was empty except for me and staff. I was greeted by a nice guy in the front. He brought me to my seat and took my order. I couldn't help but notice the staff. You see the staff eats at the resturant too. I acutally saw a guy who was the hotel manager talking to his boss having breakfast at the restaurant. Now what was so funny was they were so loud I could hear the conversation. From lady ordering a diet coke. To them bad mouthing one of the employee's and talking about the internal work related gossip. It was nice watching it for entertainment value but I couldn't help but think how unprofessional. Yet then this took the cake. I see one of the employees coming across the dining room with lunch she heated up to kiss her boyfriend. I think this is what lunch rooms are for not the front lobby of a hotel. I couldn't help but think of my job and I'm on vactaion (heheheh). When the food came I was very happy, it was yummmy. I wish I wasn't so distracted by all the unproffesional staff who decided to takeover the lobby and resturant. Tacky is all I can say. (Room Service 3rd chance) Again as I said I love room service and the food was good. So ordered again for a night snack. Now that I knew I was getting a doggy box my expectations were lower. Well when I ordered the cocktail that was on the room service menu in the room. The guy told me we don't deliver drinks to your room. When I told him " the guy before did" he said " Well ok ......." If something is a rule the management needs to stick to it. If you dont deliver drinks to the room remove the drink menu from your rooms. It's not rocket science it's just common since. He came up shortly after with a plastic cup my mojitio in it. Couldn't help but laugh. Hey I knew how crappy room service was and ordered again. So couldn't help but laugh as I took another soak in the tub I desperately wanted. The question I ask is the funky decor a replacement for giving good service So over all if you are spending like $39-$69 this place is alright for the price, at least its not Circus or Hooters (LOL) That was the price on Orbitiz. Yet if you pay the $100- $200 on the Rumors site you will feel extremely disapointed and it would be a rip off. Stay some place with a more professional staff for that price. The decor makes the place seem all hip and cool but the service reminds you how tacky the place really is. Not to mention the $11 resort fee. Yeah this place has allot of hidden fee's. Again read the fine prints always.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, OK location, nice services = positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Alveja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rumor for 8 days. It is a really nice 3 star hotel, for the stars they have - it is an outstanding hotel. If you are looking for something chick on Strip, Rumor is not your choice, but if you are looking for something more relaxed, with nice pool area and funky design - it's your place. Room: Pros : great design, big and comfy bed, we had a hot tub, nice range of bathroom amenities, iron with board clean and nice. Cons: small sings of wear but really tiny, rainshower (I simply do not like it), not enough light (on the first floor opening shades during the day is not an option) Hotel and service: they did not have our reservation, but sorted out everything quickly and we ended up even paying less than planned, no free breakfast, hussle with complimentary coffee in the morning, maids did they word well, great pool area with cabanas, valet parking only is available. Location: 10 minutes walk from strip, but none walks in Vegas anyways, so we went to Hard Rock (across the street) for taxi, they had a line there. There are couple of restaurants nearby, pharmacy and liquor shop. Overall, we had great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on What You are Looking For”
Reviews.Author: Joski69
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Rumor in a Deluxe Suite facing the rear of the property. Cost was just over $300 total as they were running a third night free special. Our room was upstairs facing the back of the property. While the website offers a clear depiction of the rooms layout, it does not show the wear and some short comings of the accommodations. Starting with room location, don't assume you will have a view. Ours was of a low income apartment complex and dumpster out back. Understanding you can upgrade to a view of the courtyard, it was not important to us and we did not elect to do so. The furnishings and carpet are starting to show wear but the room seemed clean throughout our stay. Even with the size of this room, it is seriously lacking in storage. The closet is half size of what you typically get in 3-4 star hotels and there is next to zero other storage. One night stand with two small drawers and and small desk with another two small drawers. We were forced to stack three suitcases in the corner of the living area and live from those. The bathroom has one sink and very little counter space. The rooms towel storage occupies the small shelf you do have and there are no towel bars anywhere in the bath. Rain shower was nice but a little light on pressure but acceptable. Each room had separate wall mounted climate control but the mild temperatures did not require it's use so we cannot speak to their effectiveness. King bed comfortable as was the padded chair and sofa in the living area. Wet bar area was sufficient for a few bottles and mixers. Hotel location is not in the best part of Las Vegas. Short taxi ride from strip. Walking to CVS a few blocks away, you can expect to encounter some homeless and less than desirable characters that likely live in the surrounding apartments. We are frequent city travelers and not bothered by these elements but did become considered when a homeless person entered the hotel and appeared at the ultra hip lounge next to us while we are sipping drinks. The bartender waited a few minutes and then called security. He happened to be outside flirting with some recent arrivals and finally made his way over to escort the gentleman out. When we inquired about security at the hotel, we were told the "he" )singular) roams the property all night. Seems a little under stated considering the hotel size and location. Convenience to walk across to the Hard Rock is great. The amenities there are typical Vegas so you have the best of both worlds. Restaurant at the hotel has GREAT food. We have room service for breakfast - Breakfast sliders, Butterfinger pancakes and breakfast potatoes were all amazing! We did not experience any service related issues but spent little time at the hotel. Many reviews site noise issues and there is no question the layout supports those concerns. Hotel was very quiet during our stay but at occupancy, bring the ear plugs or be ready to party. Although initially disappointed with the short comings upon arrival, the hotel grew on us - hence the 4 star rating. If coming back for a group or takeover, we would stay again but otherwise will more likley move on to other Vegas hotels. If you get a good deal, and don't mind being away from the Vegas madness, give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Service 3.5 Star Appearance”
Reviews.Author: loggedoff
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well decorated but not kept up. It's pretty good for a 3 star hotel actually, but if you're used to 4 star hotels you'll likely be underwhelmed. Also, there's no free breakfast; not sure why trip advisor said that. Anecdote: We checked in our first of three nights and the somehow mistakenly put us into the junior suite when we paid for and reserved the deluxe suite. When we went to the front desk the next morning to let them know, there was zero apology, zero attempt at making up for the mistake and we were simply told that we would have to wait until 4pm and they would put us in the appropriate suite. This is a reminder why I don't stay at 3 star hotels no matter how well they're rated on Trip Advisor. The level of service is just embarrassing, Really disappointing. Generally speaking though, it's a very hip 3 star hotel and we were able to get it for a very good price from agoda. Forgot to mention that the doors might as well be missing as far as noise reduction is concerned. This is Vegas and people get in late. Were they whispering you could hear them while you lay in bed, but they definitely weren't whispering.

Reviews.Title: “I'll ONLY stay at Rumor from now on!”
Reviews.Author: Alex562
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rumor this past weekend with my husband to celebrate our 14 year anniversary. Our stay there was stupendous. The beautiful rooms, friendly staff and personal attention we received from the manager Allen Oakley was nothing but the best. The rooms are modern, clean and quiet. My husband and I agreed that we would never stay anywhere else but at Rumor when visiting Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great design, very good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IMNash
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days here - we had a car, so this applies only if you're driving. Pros + really great location (you're 5 min from the strip) + free valet parking + room design is nice + very friendly staff + like the whole modern minimalist ambient + we had a small balcony - perfect breakfast spot Cons - when there's heavy traffic at the airport, it can get a bit noisy - rooms overlooking the street can get noisy - you can expect some parties around the pool, things can get loud - no ice machine, you need to ask for ice at the bar

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked this hotel because it was in our budget and looked like a fun place from the website pics. We arrived and checked in. The host was very pleasant and answered all our questions with a smile. we got to our room and this room was WOW!!!! so cool !! So modern so fun!! Our sunkin tub was a little dirty so we called the front desk and they said for us to talk to the manager Allen who said that he was so sorry and upgraded us the next night to a mega suite! It was the coolest thing I had ever seen! Not only was the staff so nice and friendly but the hotel is perfect for a fun get away especially if you dont want to be bothered with the crowds or casino. Cystal at the front desk was also very helpful and made this trip fabulous. We will be back for sure!! Simply perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Much cooler than it looks - and it looks pretty cool!”
Reviews.Author: SimplyJess
Reviews.Content: We'll never stay anywhere else again! From the super fun and sexy decor to the amazing service, Rumor Boutique Hotel provided us with an amazing experience. The moment we checked in, our very disorganized and unruly group was treated very well. The rooms are downright amazing, with the best bathtubs and beds I've ever seen - even in the luxury hotels. Rumor sports a gorgeous pool area, complete with several lounging areas including cabanas, beds, hammocks, and such - making for a really fun evening atmosphere. 3 days later, our still disorganized and unruly group needed just about everything under the sun - cabs, late checkouts, directions, and concierge extraordinaire Britnee accommodated our every request, all with a smile on her face, leaving us with a smile on ours. All weekend long, the staff - from the front desk to the housekeepers and groundskeepers - were incredibly friendly, polite, and helpful. The price couldn't be beat, and the environment is super fun, sexy and young. We'll never stay anywhere else. Thanks, Rumor!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Hodge73
Reviews.Content: I recently had my birthday in Vegas during the first weekend of October, and chose Rumor as my base of operations for the weekend. All I can say is WOW...SUPER SEXY!!! This hotel changed my whole perception of Las Vegas! Speaking as a person that prefers to stay away from the madness until it's time, this hotel is "the shizzle" by far! From the time we walked in, til the time we checked out...we were in absolute heaven!!! The staff, the service, the decor, and the ambiance were all fantastic. Ben Ortiz...YOU ROCK! The bottle of Champagne for my birthday...forget about it!!! All I have to say is Rumor is on Sheen status: WINNING!!! You have found a couple loyal customers who will go out of their way to let people know about this "hidden" gem! Damien & Ricci Hodge

Reviews.Title: “perfect! No need for more.”
Reviews.Author: victorp90
Reviews.Content: From begining to end rumor proved to be one of the best in las vegas. The valet was awesome and convinient and chacking in at the front desk was fast and helpful and the front desk girls were very attractive which is a plus. The food was amazing especially the breakfast sliders and the rooms were super nice! The place is away from the chaos of the strip but still fun scene to be at. Will be going back soon

Reviews.Title: “What a FIND!”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. It’s such a little gem that is right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. We live here in Vegas and have stayed at almost every hotel in town. Sure, it doesn’t have the huge glamour of the mega resorts but the rooms here have all the modern feel that makes for an incredible evening. Don’t get me wrong if you’re looking for the Bellagio, City Center or Wynn then you should go spend the $400 and stay there. But, if you like to jam ‘econo’ from time to time then this is worth every penny! The staff was wonderful the whole time we were there. From the gentleman who parked our car, to Toni (? hope that’s right, I’m terrible with names?) who took AMAZING care of us when we checked in and even Amanda our server in the restaurant who made it feel like we were having dinner at her house. Everyone had a smile and everyone was very helpful. Two recommendations to the hotel, tell Vic that if/when he’s strolling thru the dinning room he should make an attempt to stop and say hi to the customers. I watched him on the Food Network and I know his high-flying character would go over so well in that atmosphere. By the way Vic, the Sliders and Mac cheese sticks were awesome. Second comment to the hotel, take the bar menu off the website if your not going to serve those drinks. I was so looking forward to that peach Sangria. We did stay on a Thurs night so I can’t comment on the late night music at the pool. I can say that I love what they did with the remodel of the rooms. Money was well spent to make them as inviting as possible. It is now our go to spot when we see a concert at the The Joint. In fact, Incubus is this Sat night and it would save us a taxi ride home. (If the price isn’t too crazy this weekend.)

Reviews.Title: “Really good but not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Amtex
Reviews.Content: They have a few hidden costs and taxes, like a resort fee of $26 for the 'free' Internet and valet service. They also hold a deposit in case the room gets damaged or you smoke in the room, even though my room already smelt of cigarette smoke. The room is very cool and boutique looking and not far from the strip. The staff were generally nice and helpful apart from the girl who checked me out, she was extremely unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “I'd say 3 Star amenities, 5 star staff”
Reviews.Author: GrammaOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here because it was pet friendly and right next door to our business event -plus my daughter likes their sister property,The Artisan. We checked in on a Monday and left the following Monday. Our 2 room suite was a "Super 8" or "Motel 6" type set-up, probably the worst room on the premises since we overlooked the valet stand right outside of our windows. They need to install some draperies other than black out curtains or at the least darken the window glass, we found it so annoying -total blackout or our entire room visible to every car that entered the drive. The lighting is horrible -one light in the front room only wall lamps in the bedroom and the bulbs were 40watt or less. Phone in our room never worked, we were short one remote for the TV. The A/C worked great -I like it penguin cold. The room isn't set up for storage of clothes -the closet is barely bigger than a large gym locker and there is no dresser other than the 2 side drawers of a makeup table/vanity in the bedroom- although you can't use it for doing makeup because the TV is mounted right above it. Bathroom vanity space is nearly non-existent and the "bowl sink" they have installed on the counter is too high for anyone under 5'6"; also it created a tsunami wave out the far side if you turned the water flow on too high. The room was also not efficient for doing any work. No desk, no real table to work upon and poor lighting. I made do with my laptop on the little round table and extra chairs for laying out my work, but not a great setup. Housekeeping was lazy. They took our opened bar of soap everyday, but didn't replace it with a fresh one every time, towels were the same -they would take them whether we hung them up or left them on the floor and then would leave half the amount --sorry but they should know 2 women use a lot of towels. We left beer bottles on the table and they stayed there for 3 days in exactly the same spot, I truly don't think they did much more than make the beds -but they were actively cleaning in all of the public areas. Overall, the place appears clean, but I don't feel the quality of our room justified the price we paid for it. Now, for the staff. Wonderful! Ben at "Addictions" was fabulous, professional and provided service like you were on a cruise ship. We loved the food. This portion of the hotel is an absolute gem, relaxing indoor or outdoor dining. Valet service also excellent. Those guys were polite and friendly even though it was over 110 degrees every day. Front desk staff was good and bartenders for the most part were excellent. The facilities may be overpriced, but the service is commendable and due to their merit I would possibly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly ;)”
Reviews.Author: Diana H
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing ! The rooms are very clean, and all the staff members are extremely friendly and helpful in every way. Living on Key West we have great resorts as well, I just wish the owners of Rumor would open one here, I would recommend this resort to everyone !! My partner and I were there during "Shedonism" and felt very welcomed. One last thing, the beds are amazingly comfy (I wish I knew who the mfg is, hint, hint ). Thanks again !! Diana Hansen

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable; great value!”
Reviews.Author: molissa83
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one Friday night...Upon arrival, you can valet park to the right or self-park to the left; however, there are only 15 self-park spots if you're lucky! Check-in was smooth and the room was easy to locate, as the property is relatively small. Room and Bathroom were very clean, air-conditioning worked well but had an older smell to it. The hot-tub in the room was clean but so old that the paint/plaster (?) on the inside was chipping off which made it appear not so hot; didn't try it for this reason! We had a Junior Suite, Oasis (Pool) view on the first floor. Our patio was practically at the pool; no privacy. Would defiantely recommend the top floor.The hotel lobby, small lounge area share an area with the bar and mini-restaurant. We had Chili-Cheese Fries and some drinks for a snack, not bad at all. Our visit was very quiet and the grounds did not seem that busy. Management is very helpful and responds to any questions or concerns you have via email and phone promptly. You can tell they try very hard to keep their guests happy and I thank them for this!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: sonyah67
Reviews.Content: Employee Toni was great. Thankyou for everything. Food was yummy!!!. Room was perfect. We will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & dog-friendly. Is there anything better?”
Reviews.Author: Mybincs
Reviews.Content: What a find! I was just looking for a hotel that my dog could stay at on our cross-country trip and stumbled on Rumor. For an amazing price we stayed at an amazing hotel nicer than any other place I've stayed in Vegas AND since I don't gamble I enjoyed the ambiance rather than watch peeps lose Thetis shirts. A definite recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BobandLulu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rumour midweek in July. We truly enjoyed our stay. Hotel location is great. Close enough to the strip but far enough to be away from the masses. Parking valet is easy free and friendly. We arrived late 11pm and check-in was a breeze. Off to our room to find a nice bottle of champagne for having book online. What an unexpected bonus!! Our room was facing a parking lot. This did not bother us as it surely is more quiet than those facing the courtyard with the music. Our room was spacious with 2 queen beds, a couch an armchair and a table with 2 chairs. Nice bathroom with a water closet and a large tiled shower but dimly lit. They could use some towel racks. :) We LOVED the beds. They were soo comfy. The breakfast at Addiction restaurant was delicious and affordable. Looking forward to having dinner the next time we come. We enjoyed our stay so much that when checking out we asked about booking 2 rooms for our wedding in October. She told us it was full for October and the only rooms available were 3x the price. So she suggested we try booking directly online. Upon our return, we were happy to find 2 rooms availble when booking online However, I'm disappointed that I have not receivced a reply to the 2 emails I sent. Because we've read that the music can be very loud on the week-ends, I want to ensure we have rooms close to each other in a quiet area. Otherwise, staff was great and we are looking forward to our return trip in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Suite Hotel...My doggies loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mastermisty
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, LOVED that it was NON-SMOKING!!!! The rooms were adorable and quiet. Lots of room. The restaurant was great with good service. I had two small dogs and there was no problem...had a place to walk them. I would definitely stay here again. There was some airport/airplane noise, but everything else compensated for that one thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Las Vegas party weekend”
Reviews.Author: myvoiceofreason
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about all the reasons you should not stay at this property. There are a good many reasons....however, I realized that this place is perfect for a certain type of guest and I am not that guest. I like properties that are professionally run top to bottom and this place is not. Allen, the GM, does his best but you can tell his hands are pretty much tied by the owner....The owner of this hotel wants it to be a loud, bustling, glamorous place where, God-willing a celebrity will accidentally overdoses and bring it into the spotlight. He wants it to be the scaled down version (only in size, not bass) of the neighboring Hard Rock Hotel with its Rehab party. This is NEVER going to happen. This property is owned by The Siegel Group. These guys own second rate hotels and shopping malls. They have another "up-scale" property in Vegas called, "The Artisan" that was previously a Travel Lodge. The rest are pretty budget..Gold Spike, Siegel Suites. The Good: Young, lively, fairly attentive staff (see the UGLY below tho). Average clean rooms. Good beds, edgy furnishings. Better than average hotel food in their restaurant. This place is really trying to be something. Sadly, I suspect it's trying to be the wrong thing given the property. The F&B manager and the GM really try. They do. I suspect the owner is the problem with this property. The Bad: I stayed here 6 nights: Saturday through Thursday and with the exception of one night there was unbelievably loud music playing at the pool...often until 1 or 2 am. The bass is so over the top that in our room we could feel the bass beat in our chests. I like loud music and I like a lot of bass but this was absolutely ridiculous. You could not sit in your room and have a conversation without yelling. But hey...it's Las Vegas so maybe you're not supposed to be in your room at 1am anyway. Sadly, we were there working so sleep was a must. If you like to sleep anytime after midnight...I'd pass on this place. Pass...no matter what Mr. Oakley, the GM, says in his response to this and other comments about the noise. Remember, when the pool is in season this place wants to be Rehab. BOOM, BOOM, BOOM. Got it? Also, the rooms need a little more attention to detail. For example no towel racks, soap dishes, refrigerators in the rooms. Also, don't get too excited about the soaking tubs in some of the rooms. They basically painted over cultured marble tubs so the tub itself is pretty marred and does not look too great. No jets. Just you, your current best friends and some hot water. On the positive side, the ridiculous bass beat did make the water vibrate a bit. The Ugly: The staff here will lie right to your face. However, you cannot blame them. They are helpless when it comes to the music, etc. They will tell you it's going to end by 10pm...it went until 2am. The game seems to be to tell you what you want to hear because they have been here before and they know it's going to be a battle if they tell you the truth. If you're 21 years old or like to act like you are on occasion, then by all means stay here. It's perfect for that. If you want a place to stay in Las Vegas that offers some fun options but can also be a great place to recover from a night out on the town...do not stay here. The noise alone will make sleeping a problem unless you plan on sleeping from 2am to noon. Anytime after that...all bets are off.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but other options work better for me”
Reviews.Author: carlbrochu
Reviews.Content: Rumor is nice and definitely different. The pool is ok but the music start a little on the early side (deep bass coming into all rooms at 10am?). The rooms are nice, not quite as nice as the pictures on their website. The occupancy % when we visited must have been really low. We saw only a handful of people at any time. We had one breakfast sent to the room and it was good. Nothing fancy. The hotel is near the Hard Rock and we did have a nice day at the pool there. However, you need to cab back and forth to the strip. Overall, nice option, but being on the strip is really valuable.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katieheath
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff, friendly and helpful. Cool hip furnishings. Great bed, great garden tub. Breakfast only for us,and you must try the Belgium Waffles with bacon IN them! A short hike to the strip, cab it for safety at night. Across from Hard Rock with a low resort fee, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Joyfulbliss11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at Rumor after we noticed it this spring when we stayed at the Hardrock. We were pleased with our decision as soon as we stepped out of the car. The valet almost treated us as if they had been expecting us and were excited we were there. The girl Tony who check us in at the frontdesk acted even more excited and took the time to ask us about our trip and even recomended some shows and places to eat. We were amazed at how chic the rooms were and even joked about how our Yuppie friends in LA would be jealous of our great find. Later, on the way out, Tony greeted us as we were walking through the lobby as if she knew us personally and even offered to help us book tickets for a show! A major surprise for us since we were so use to being almost invisible to te frontdesk after check-in at other, large hotels. We regret that we did not eat at the resturant that was located in the lobby, but before we knew it- it was time to leave. I felt as if I was leaving friends behind, but both of us look forward to our next stay! If you are looking for a small hotel that makes you feel as though you've found a secret spot in Vegas were the staff becomes your friends, I absolutley suggest staying at Rumor. The secret Is out!

Reviews.Title: “Purple campy awesomishness”
Reviews.Author: Doken
Reviews.Content: One of those brutal hot blue Las Vegas skies raining 109 Fahrenheit down on our befuddled and slightly deranged heads. We arrived at our whit oasis of pixar high def vivid cartoonish green fake lawns and oddly out of place but not unpleasant Chinese dragon dogs. Our tall lanky boy next door porter inexplicable sprinted off into the shimmering heat waves and disappeared, and just as inexplicably sprinted back!! , why anyone would sprint in that heat is beyond me but it was commendable and courageous and he handled our luggage as if they where divine infants swaddled in soft blankets. He looked good coming and going. He was handsome at both ends! Easy on the eyes. Check in was a complex affair due to no fault of our solid unshakable competent hostess plainly used to dealing with crazy half baked or hammered guests. She gently guided us like a tall dark haired understanding compassionate Madonna kindergarten teacher. Gently correcting our unreasonable demands and with leisurely ease and elegant hand gestures she parried and deflected our frantic ninja style assault of credit cards and large wads of greasy cash as we battled each other and her to see who would be paying for this adventure. Our check in settled to a uneasy but sustainable Balkanized truce we where led like brain damaged patients to our room , I noticed that there was a huge silver metal pig in one corner and a black featureless wasp like feminine creature sat unmoving in a plush chair eternally poised to sip a nonexistent cocktail, I glimpsed a dinner room its candle operas spooling and tumbling in rivulets of melted wax and black coffin like chairs looking like something Edward scissor hands would envision, I turned and noticed a small white porcelain monkey gargoyle jiving me with hand signals. The DJ , all high school gothic and high cheekbones with long bangs smiled at me and waved his silver finger rings at me. I gave him the thumbs up and a Turkish military salute. I had to stop and think , had I taken blotter acid accidently again? Our room was a dazzling wonderful train wreck of silver purple and white leather. Clean towels as far the eye could see and giant baroque mod prim patterns. Big basin sinks and hypoallergenic white linen. Free Champaign and giant white bathtub, The décor could be a 80,s porno or a goth nightmare before Xmas or cutting edge gay LA chic, interpretation would depend on your age, education and level of inebriation. I found all three acceptable, stripped to my boxers and drank the bottle of FREE Champaign with copious amounts of ice and cranberries juice. The pool is a delight to the eyes, soaring palm trees and white stucco against that blue brutal sky, I loved the wheelbarrow full of towels and the free beach balls and excellent trancy music!!! The bar tender was awesome and a little apologetic but mixed a stern cocktails and my routine 7 am bloody Mary was brimming with olives and pepper , nice and spicy! His humble dedication to making sure I was properly pickled in alcohol was both inspiring and touching, may the gods of bar tending be kind to his tender soul. Our Kitchen staff kept us well fed with decent, fresh edible food. And even threw in a few inventive treats, Since I always spring screaming and ready for physical hand to hand combat when I wake up at 5 am every day I make it a point to meet the cleaning staff. I found them to be true blue color hard working Americans with solid work ethic and beautiful children. I made a few bizarre senseless requests for the room just to test their metal and they complied to the letter without complaint!!. After that I feared not for our high end expensive digital hardware and avant-garde luxury hand-crafted leather Louis Vuitton brickerbrack and my travel bag of stainless steel spider-co harpy fighting knives. We came and went as we pleased unmolested and completed our ritual Vegas shakedown rape and pillage and where gently but firmly led to our waiting ride and returned to airport happy and fulfilled. Now this is a young hotel and they are not yet fully formed in their services. They still need to get sterile glass ware in the bathroom and who ever thought of putting gravel next to a pool was either sadistic or wearing shoes, needs a good talking to, and ever so often you can sense that the place is still young , slightly insecure but totally sincere and enthusiastic. Its hands down now my favorite place to stay, sorry Giant pyramid we can still be friends and I will come party with you but I am now sleeping with palm trees and pleasantly geeky bellboys at Rumor!! ( I didn’t actually sleep with the bellboys…it was just rhetorical statement…)

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyM777
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 1 year anniversary and chose Rumor Hotel for a few reasons. Specifically because it did NOT have the noise and chaos of a casino hotel. We wanted something quiet and romantic. We live in Las Vegas and get enough of the Strip hotels, so this was a nice change. We have driven by the property many times and once we looked at their website, we were sold. The colorful, swanky rooms were very inviting, along with the jacuzzi tubs in the rooms. We were so pleased with the entire stay. The restaurant, Addiction, had amazing food, and we even got a visit from the Executive Chef, Michael Rizzo, who was extremely friendly and made us feel right at home. The entire staff from check-in till check-out was warm and hospitable. Crystal at the front desk, and Robert, property security, were super friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated Ben Ortiz, the Food & Beverage Manager, who treated us like royalty! He was such a hard worker and jumping in to help wherever necessary. We will definitely stay again at the Rumor Hotel. It exceeded all of our expectations!! Ron & Tiffany Las Vegas, NV

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of your belongings while staying here!”
Reviews.Author: SLH007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Rumor many times, and really enjoy the ambiance and amenities of this hotel, but I finally had a bad incident that, people who are considering staying here, should be aware of. I was in a rush to check out (having spent several days there on business) and forgot to clean out one of the drawers I had used, which had some expensive clothing items in it. I realized my mistake when I got home four hours later, and immediately called the hotel. I was told that they would go and check my room and call me back. They didn't. I called back the next morning to ask if someone could please check my room or housekeeping so I could get my clothes back. I was told that my room still had not been cleaned yet, but I would be contacted. I was, once again, not called back, so a few hours later I called again. THEN I was told that housekeeping had not found anything left in my room, which I know for a fact is false. I know exactly what I left behind and where. Now, I know that it is my fault for leaving personal items behind, and that Rumor is not responsible for that. However, it is clear that someone in their housekeeping staff is untrustworthy and a thief. So, if you're planning on staying here, make sure you lock up your valuables, and you might even want to not unpack your clothes, but keep them locked in your suitcase. Since they have employed an untrustworthy person who is doing this when people accidentally leave things behind, it's likely this person will start taking things when people are still staying there. Do I plan to stay at Rumor again? Yes, because I do like the feeling of this place, and it suits my needs and mood. But I will make absolutely certain to never leave accidentally anything behind again, and I will keep anything I care about locked up in my suitcase!

Reviews.Title: “Blessedly casino-free, dog-friendly boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNamaste
Reviews.Content: Rumor is basically the world's coolest apartment complex, assuming your apartment complex is populated with attractive childless people who are really into pool parties, cocktails, and great food. If "boutique hotel" means that a property has a unique set of features that reflect its purpose and identity, then Rumor is a perfect example of the genre. The most distinctive feature of Rumor compared to the rest of Las Vegas properties is that it has no casino. Not even a little mini-casino. So if you really like the sound of a thousand people randomly ringing doorbells every time you walk from your room to the hotel exit, then Rumor is not for you, since there are no slot machines. The bar has some video poker action, but that's it for gambling. A related feature is that there is no indoor smoking, and indeed there are substantial financial penalties that will show up on your hotel bill if you smoke in the non-smoking areas. But the best feature of Rumor is the pool area. Rumor is arranged as a series of low buildings around a huge central courtyard area. One half of that area is dedicated to the large pool, hot tub, cabanas with televisions and couches, loungers, and occasionally open wet bar. The other half is dedicated to a large lawn surrounded by palm trees (with hammocks!) and a sound stage. If you think this sounds like a total party setup, you're right. There aren't parties all the time, but far more often than not there will be music outside, a DJ in the lobby, and revelers from Miami models to LA rockers to Jersey Shore refugees taking in the sun, the music, and the cocktails. Rumor is all about the pool scene, which means that the clientele are generally not American midwesterners on vacation with their families. Rather, you will mostly see younger people whose level of fitness is not simply measured by whether or not they can see their toes. It also means that Rumor is basically a party hub for the Las Vegas area, so you can't swing your suitcase around without hitting a DJ. Dance music is loud, especially if you are not at the party, and even more so if you weren't invited. But the dance music is just part of Rumor, and if you want a completely silent room, ask yourself why you chose Las Vegas rather than, say, a tent in the bottom of a canyon in Utah. If you want to minimize the noise, ask for a junior suite with skyline view, near the front entrance. Basically these rooms are the most insulated from the various party areas (lobby, pool, etc). The staff at Rumor are super friendly and helpful. However, they work a bit differently than at many hotels (particularly in the restaurant area). Rumor employees are always moving around helping people. They are not sitting around flipping through a magazine at the hostess stand. So, for example, if you want help at the restaurant (Addiction, which I review separately), walk in and sit down at the bar-height area or at a dining table, and someone will immediately help you. This may seem a little strange if you're expecting someone to be waiting nearby all the time, but it does not mean bad service. In fact Rumor has some of the best service I've seen at a property, which is all the more impressive because the property is managing parties, talent, different dining areas, safety, and registration all at once. A special note about room service: Rumor offers room service from Addiction (the hotel restaurant), including breakfast. In perhaps my favorite detail at Rumor, food and beverages are delivered without using trays. Instead, food and drink are packaged and carried neatly in containers and a tote bag. Having stayed at hundreds of properties around the world with decent room service, this is one of the few I've ever encountered that didn't leave behind a stupid tray that requires you to call for pickup to keep it from stinking up the room or cluttering the hallway. Simple genius, and much appreciated. Finally, there are some drawbacks to Rumor, mostly related to its distance from the strip. The valet service is helpful and prompt, and useful if you have your own vehicle. But if you're not planning ahead, getting a taxi is sometimes a pain. On at least two occasions I actually walked across the street to Hard Rock's taxi stand rather than wait at Rumor. But this is not a big issue. A bigger issue that is not a problem for me, but important to know if you are considering Rumor, is that it is not really a property for children. While they undoubtedly would learn a lot about the variety of people in the world, the property is much more of a playground for adults than for kids. On the other hand, if your dogs are your kids, you're in luck, because Rumor is super dog-friendly, up to and including the semi-chaotic "Yappy Hour" held occasionally in the lawn area for dogs and their people (yes, there is music for that, too). So, yes on dogs, no on children. Plan accordingly. But if you're traveling without kids, and you're at least fit enough to see your toes, plan to stay at Rumor when you're in Las Vegas. I won't be staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Gigi A
Reviews.Content: You get what u pay for. Luckily I got this room discounted under a promo as I paid for my room 2 weeks in advanced.. I wonder if my services were depreciated because of that. I had to wait 3 hours for my room just to get a dirty spa tub, roll-a-way bed, and rude staff. Again, I paid for my room 2 weeks prior to my stay! I requested an hour extended check out that didn't get granted because my room was taken, and I was blocked in my parking spot which happen to be handicap space. Another tenant decided to create their own parking space; therefore, I couldn't get into to my car w/ out pain (I'm disabled and I had to crawl from the passenger seat to to driver's seat to get into my car. Yes, that was explained to Brittne). When I brought this up Brittne, she was rude, snappy, rolled her eyes at me and basically said oh well, I can't do anything about you being blocked in, the room situation or extend your check. She never apologized. I'm ok about my few dollars not being worthy to them... Never again. Dr. Gigi

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for the horrible loud Dj from Thursday till Sunday night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: greenfishflyer
Reviews.Content: OMG some one please give these people a clue!! We went for a combined business/ pleasure trip (my husband was there for business and I went along to relax). They have a really friendly dog policy and even advertise a "yappy hour", which is part of why I chose this hotel. The price was really good to. When we arrived on a Tuesday- we thought we had found the perfect boutique hotel in Vegas. Great rooms with free wifi, a gorgeous open courtyard and pool area, and very accessible restaurant/ bar. The staff wax nice but not super on top of it- we had to call several times to have any requests responded to and they often gave us wrong info. The problems started on Thursday when I prepared for "happy hour". Basically, they invite people to bring there dogs (great idea) but then had a DJ playing the WORST kind of Vegas club music w speakers and volume as if she was playing for an audience of 600,000 at Madison square garden. I mean COME ON??!!!! the dogs were all going crazy and you literally couldn't have a conversation. I tried to escape back to my room, but the volume of the music was so freaking loud that the room was shaking. My dog hid under the bed, and I couldn't even hear someone on the other end of a phonecall or hear the tv at full volume over the horrible music. I had to wait it out and was miserable dnd angry. Little fix I know the onslaught would continue throughout HHS entire weekend. They hac this horrible Dj there the rest of the time, same volume. When we complained, they first kept lyi v about low long the Dj was playing, and then they said ghat they were a south beach style "party hotel" and were catering to the party crowd.
