I wish they'd take there heads out of their $$!#%'s and realize that they have no party criwd there and would get more business if they would correct this one horrible mistake. Honestly, the entire to E we were there, there wax never mire than like 5 sketchy lo-rent locals at their "pool party". It's not like there is a big demand for their bad parties. It I'd SUCH a shame bc if they would alter their marketing/ business plan a little and re-identify as a boutique of spa hotel this hotel would be awesome and I would recommend to everyone. As it is now, they are basically just catering to the leftover party tweakers too cheap to pay for Hardrock across the street.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Grantperrins
Reviews.Content: Not only did i have a brilliant weekend with the 4th of july pool parties hosted by the Hotel. The recently renovated Rumor hotel is really well done. it looks and feels fantastic, all the colors and feel of the hotel are brilliant - i also received 5 star service from a lady that worked there named Toni Espinosa she went above and beyond to make my stay amazing! i will definitely be back - hoping that they hold the same event next year!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris75
Reviews.Content: Rumor Hotel is off the strip, but just a few minutes drive, in front of the Hard Rock Hotel. I like hotels with great design, so when I entered Rumor Hotel, I was immediately impressed. My room was a suite with a courtyard view, not huge, but quite large with a tub in the bedroom, a white sofa, very comfortable, pleasant with a small balcony in front of the pool. The courtyard has a beautiful garden with palm trees, and the pools. It's a lovely place where it's really pleasant to stay, day or night, even more enjoyable with good music (but not too loud). It's hip, relaxing, peaceful, the kind of place where you want to stay for hours as it's such a nice place! Food was good for breakfast (not a huge choice on the menu, but very good). The service was excellent, very friendly. The only drawback are the corridors, with a kind of motel feeling (Rumor was a former motel, but entirely renovated, with great success). Of course if you're looking for a big casino resort hotel, you may not like the Rumor, but if you like smaller hotels with great design and ambiance, it's an excellent choice. Rumor Hotel will be my first choice when I will return to Las Vegas, without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hidden little Treasure”
Reviews.Author: moralesshares
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at Rumor during the Plush party this past weekend and it may have possibly been the best Las Vegas trip we have ever had. the property is perfect for a group buyout like we part of. from the minute we pulled into valet til even after we checked out I couldn't have asked for anything better. Brandon the valet guy was wonderful super helpful everytime we arrived and left valet. Toni the young girl at the front desk was amazing it seemed as of everytime we walked by the desk no matter what time of day she was there and willing to help with anything we needed whether it be more towels, dinner reservations, helping us get on the VIP lists at nightclubs she was there with the biggest smile on her face. Brendan the bartender was also great he made amazing drinks and we had great conversations early in the monings. overall we could not have asked for anything more. almost forgot after arriving home we realized we had left a piece of luggge in our room when we called the hotel once again it was Toni who answered the phone she helped locate our bag and made sure to safely store it until a family member could pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times!”
Reviews.Author: kendall t
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our Las Vegas trip! We had a great time at the Rumors Hotel, Rooms were cute, Hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. Brittany at the front desk was very helpful getting us the information we needed.Overall, great time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: chelsea a
Reviews.Content: We came to vegas for my birthday weekend and had an amazing stay! The room was great and so was the service! The receptionist named britany was a great help and was very welcoming! The service at the bar was great also and we loved the pool! Definitely would recommend this hotel to future travlers!

Reviews.Title: “No Cigar...”
Reviews.Author: onlythebest-48
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say that this place is not quite up to what they say/appear to want it to be. The lobby is cute, the grounds clean, the rooms nicely decorated...but for what they are charging, it is not up to snuff. The check in/reservation was good and again, the room was pretty big and clean. It is the overall experience that is not up to the rates. I ordered room service, waited an hour, called and found out that the order had not even been placed (room service button on the phone did not work, had to hunt to find the actual number...and then got message saying the number was not available....finally got through). Housekeeping did not show up. Remote controlled A/C was nice, except the remote did not work. Toilet paper dispenser was coming off of the wall. Not let's be clear, this is a perfectly nice and clean place in Vegas, they just charged me as much as the strip and did not come close to the service/experience sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Third times the charm?”
Reviews.Author: MrValdi
Reviews.Content: After our 1st amazing trip to Rumor in the winter we were looking forward all season long to our next trip in the summer so we could enjoy your beautiful pool. We even encouraged 2 other couples to stay with us at the hotel. So we were all set to enjoy the summer at Rumor. After our first stay we were told that we would gain an upgrade on our next trip if we wrote a review. We did so and after booking our hotel we inquired about this over the phone. Unfortunately nobody ever told us we had to make our reservation through the Rumor website. This is the 1st idea that we had that our 2nd trip wouldn't be as nice. With this aside we were still looking forward to staying at the Rumor again. Upon arrival at the hotel we were blown away. It was a weekend reserved for a private party at the pool for Matinee. We had no idea this was happening the weekend we were staying at the hotel. There was no mention on their website or anything. We are all super-duper gay friendly (Matinee is a LGBT organization) but we were looking forward to using the pool and come to find out we were informed that we would have to pay extra to use the pool. As a guest it should be free but this was not the case. We even had to pay the resort fee at the end of the weekend. We made no fuss of this upon check out as we knew the staff was overwhelmed from the whole weekend. Two days before arriving, our friend told us about the pool being closed for a private party (she had called for a quote on a cabana and the hotel informed her at this time that the pool had been rented out. We made multiple phone calls to the manager and left numerous phone messages but never heard back. Upon arrival the disorganization continued. Our room went uncleaned the second day despite vacating our room at 11 am and making sure that the “do not disturb” sign was removed from our door. We requested clean sheets several times but to no avail. We even said we would make the bed ourselves after being informed that the housekeeping had left for the day…still no clean sheets. Then the ice machine buzzer started screaming at us which was very audible from our room. We alerted the front desk to this annoying disturbance but it went on screaming for hours until out of desperation one of the guests in a nearby room had the brilliant idea of just unplugging it. Peace at last. It may seem like we are picky and hard to please but we are very easy going people. We still had fun in Vegas despite all of these events. We had fun with our neighbors (or “gay”bors lol) and did our best to cope with 10 hours of straight techno that was so loud our walls and windows shook. We knew it was futile to complain about the volume of the music or try to get a room not directly on the pool. We get it ok…massive pool party…loud music…can’t change our room location….can’t use the pool….but dropping the ball on cleaning our room? Staff was so busy that they were unable to return a phone call or small service requests should not be ignored if you want loyal customers instead of just a great place to party. During these events more staff should be brought it. The rooms are still nice and the regular staff is cool but the management needs to think about long term loyal repeat clients versus making a ton of money by privatizing an amenity that your regular hotel guests should also be entitled to. We should have been offered free entrance to the event but since we didn’t book the room through Matinee we would’ve had to pay 35.00 per person to get in. Staff arranged for regular guests to use the pool of a neighboring property but we decided just to bite the bullet and pay to get into the Hard Rock Hotel’s pool which is just across the street. I would give the Rumor another try because our first experience in the off season was such a positive one-- I guess we will see if the third time is the charm at Rumor.

Reviews.Title: “The Rumor Needs to Pay Attention to Their Guests & Thats a Fact”
Reviews.Author: rumwalia
Reviews.Content: The Good: Property is renovated & looks good Pool area is nice, but not a lot of people so its not a great people watching place to be if thats what you want The bar in the lobby is nice place to grab a quick drink before you head out The room has all the basic ammenities you need The property is in a good location accross the street from the Hardrock Hotel There is a CVS around the corner if you want to buy alcohol for your room! The Bad: The Furniture in the room is tacky- the pillows on the sofa are attached by a buckle so you can move them. The television in sitting room portion of our suite was tiny- even for a guy with 20/20 The air condition requires a remote control & our room didnt have one. We had to wait 40 minutes to get one, but eventually it came. The Ugly: Service is less than satisfactory We ordered room service & it never showed up. Called back & found out the kitchen was closed. Call the front desk to report & they said there was nothing they could do about it. Our room was not provided service for 2 out 3 days during our stay and no I didnt leave the "DND" sign up. We actually called for service and were told we would get it but didnt. The Recovery: Upon check out we requested the manager but he wasnt on the property, but he did speak to me on the phone. He owned up to not meeting some basic expectations and cut us a deal on our rate, which was very fair. And because of this reason alone, I will give this property a second chance, but before I recommend it, I have to stay here again to make sure that my experience was an anomaly. With that being said, the property does offer a good value in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday Celebration in Vegas! July 30th.”
Reviews.Author: AcetheActor
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my Birthday in Vegas. It was as always a crazy weekend. The difference was that I stayed at Rumor boutique hotel. The Hotel is the perfect place to relax and stay away from the Las Vegas madness. Not far away from the strip, the hotel is actually located across the Hard Rock Hotel and a block away from the liquor store. :-). Its Perfect location if you want to hit rehab pool party @ the HRH on sunday. The rooms at Rumor hotel are the best ones. They are very nicely decorated and the beds are Memory foam top. Never had a better bed in any other hotel in vegas. The staff was really friendly. The Pool is big and nice if you want to relax. They were giving away a gigantic bottle of champagne for bookings in the month of july. That was perfect cause it was my birthday!! yay :-) www.joseacevedo.net

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL JUST OFF THE STRIP!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladream
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard suite which we picked up for a great price. This hotel is around about 15-20 min walk from the crossing at planet hollywood on the strip. This is a great hotel if you dont want the hussle and bussle of the strip. Its so chilled out the staff and helpful and the pool party on a sunday is great well worth a view. I will say that this is a young hotel and very hip for a young croud. The room was great i coundt fault it at all. Our hairdryer wasnt working and within 15 minutes someone brought a new hairdryer. I will be staying at this hotel again if im looking for a chilled time in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag...hip scene, good design, shoddy execution”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSF2009
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could give this place a better review. My room had some problems that indicate housekeeping is not really on the ball. iPod dock was missing, safe was dead, phone was dead, and a couple other things. To their credit, facilities took care of things pretty quickly, but it was annoying that I had to discover all these things and call front desk. The location of the hotel is pretty good, Hard Rock Hotel and Hofbrauhaus are adjacent, as are 24 hour convenience store and several good but affordable restaurants. The design of the hotel is creative and very hip, as is the crowd. No gym at Rumor, but you can pay $8 to use Hard Rock's gym/spa, which is a good deal. The pool hours at Rumor are a huge downer... the pool closes at 6pm, and there is no shade except for rental cabanas, so if you don't like frying in the sun, you're totally out of luck. During the night they play soft music in the courtyard, and it's a good place to chill out post-club. I wish the pool were open then! I didn't experience any noise problems. I would stay again if they can get on top of the room situation and if they extend the pool hours to something reasonable like 9 or 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love & I will be back next Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: sarahCDN
Reviews.Content: Where to start... It's just off the strip but not on the strip. Which is very good; you actually get to relax during the day... Party at night ;) All the staff was amazing, and you can get to know them all my name if that's your thing. Value wise, it can't be beat! The rooms are beautiful, beautiful. Food, OMG the food... it's great! Very good portions and at a price that can't be beat. Add on $2 for your plate delivered straight to your room. Lot's of space to hang, just check out their site. Book with them, you won't regret it. I'll be back ;) Canadian Girl :P

Reviews.Title: “Right idea... wrong execution.”
Reviews.Author: allens10
Reviews.Content: What Siegel company has done here is essentially take an old, run down apartment complex in Las Vegas and transform it into a hip boutique hotel. In theory, its a great idea. In reality though, this place has a long way to go before it can really be considered a good alternative to the traditional Strip hotels, or even the Hard Rock right across the street. The rooms look interesting, although some would consider them a bit over done (looks like Z Gallerie threw up in there). The tub in the bedroom surrounded by mirrors is cool... But couldn't the hotel provide at least ONE tiny little bottle of bubble bath? Same goes for shampoo and conditioner- no where to be found. There is a space in the 'living' area that looks like it is made perfectly for a small refrigerator... But there isn't one in any of the rooms. The lack of mini fridge is a bit disappointing. I get it- we're supposed to go downstairs and buy our drinks/water from the bar but you know what? Sometimes if I wake up in the middle of the night and want a cold water, it'd be nice to just have a fridge so I don't have to drag myself all the way downstairs. I could go on about the rooms- the TVs were small and useless (but who comes to Vegas to watch TV anyway- must have been what they were thinking). The wallpaper was funky, but looked like it was put up by someone who was at least 3 feet too short for the job and didn't have access to a ladder - the stuff was literally coming off the walls at the corners. Everything just feels like it was done on the cheap here. Somewhat stylish- but cheap. Room service was hit and miss... The Waldorf salad was great. The sliders (both chicken and steak) were awful. The guy answering the phone for room service was very rude. I placed my order, then called again a few minutes later to add a fruit plate to the order. "Yeah what's up?" was how he answered the phone, then proceeded to act like he was doing me a big frickin' favor by adding a lousy fruit plate to my order that I had just placed a few minutes earlier. Message to that guy - learn how to talk on the phone buddy, especially when you're talking to the people who are indirectly paying your salary. The biggest issue I had was with the music. It started promptly at 1030am and was turned up so loud that I could feel the bass in my stomach as I was laying in bed (not hungover). Sort of like an unwanted wake up call. When you get down to the pool the surroundings are nice enough, they have cabanas and day beds but my god... That music literally drove me insane. It's one thing to be in a party atmosphere, its another to have your ear drums blown out by bad techno music. If you spend the entire day at the pool and in your room, you will find yourself driven to the brink of insanity by the nonstop bass unless you just get plastered and pass out or leave the hotel. I've been to just about every day club in Las Vegas ranging from Wet Republic to Marquee to Tao Beach and have never had my ears assaulted in such an awful way. Am I being nit-picky? Maybe. The thing is, this place is being marketed as a good alternative to staying at the bigger, more expensive Strip hotels. For it to be that alternative, it needs to be EXCEPTIONAL in every way. The service needs to be stepped up. The rooms need mini fridges and general touch ups on the decor. And for God's sake, turn down the damn music. Success in this industry is all about the little things. Rumor has all the makings of a place that could be successful, they just need to focus more on the little things!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: kluue
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Rumor hotel this past weekend and let me just say I wish we stayed somewhere on the strip. The front desk botched up our rooms and gave us a complimentary upgrade. Awesome right? No. We had 8 girls and they said they could not gaurentee more than 1 cot, fine. But they did say they would gaurantee to give us enough blankets and towels.... funny thing is, they ran out of blankets!!!! What hotel runs out of blankets? So we had to use sheets to sleep on the floor! Also when we called for towels we would have to call 3x to finally get them! To add insult to injury, the next day we go lay out at the pool and want a blended drink. The guy outside says he doesn't have a blender and to go inside to the lobby bar. My friend asks the guy assisting the bartender if they can make blended drinks, so he walks over to the bartender and ask her and she says out loud "I'm not making blended drinks today! I'm just not making them!" My friend walks over to her and asks if there is an issue, and she says she just doesn't make mixed blended drinks and says "Fine! What do you want!" My friend just walked away. Now we know to stick to hotels we know have great service, Rumor definately doesn't have it.

Reviews.Title: “The room is nice, that is it!”
Reviews.Author: markdegoffau
Reviews.Content: The rooms are absolutely nice and the oversized shower head is awesome, but the place is made for party people, the pool is crowded with drunk people and you are not allowed to bring a drink to the pool, not even a bottle of water. Instead you can buy a overpriced drink at the pool. Even the pool rules are clearly mentioned at the pool gates, you are not allowed to be in the pool while being under influence, well the opposite is the truth. Trying to sleep is the best you can do once at your room, very loud house music is playing till 2am. Airplanes flying over every 5 minutes. There is no fridge at the room, cause they want you to buy overpriced drinks, for example a case of beer (24) is $144. THAT IS INSANE!! You could buy drinks of the street but the are not to happy with that, you can keep you drinks cool by getting ice from ice machines placed in some buildings, but most of the time they don't work. The valet doesn't park your car in a garage so if you want to go to the strip you step in a very hot vehicle, you could walk but it takes a 30 minutes. Overall, I wouldn't stay again at this place, I know it is Vegas, but music till 2am and then vacuuming the hall way at 9am, that's not Vegas style! Not again!! Never!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: PinkCOgurl
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I stayed at the Rumor for our girls weekend recently and it couldn't have gone more smooth. The girls at the front desk were great and Brittany helped start the trip on a positive note. She was very knowledgable with every question we had and had great recommendations for activities. We spent a lot of time at the pool and loved the whole atmosphere! I'll be sure to come back on my next trip to Vegas and have already recommended it to a few friends. Thanks for the great trip, see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room but that's about all”
Reviews.Author: snugette23
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to save a little cash and it was good for that. Kind of a step between a budget hotel and strip hotel. The hotel has obviously been remodeled from an old hotel...and they definitely accomplished a different, current and more boutique look. The rooms themselves were cute. Probably our favorite part of the hotel. Not sound proof in anyway, including the constant airplanes flying overhead. The pool was promoted to have a chill out Dj on Sunday's but it was pounding commercial dance music (we are djs and love electronica...was still a bit much for us). The pool vibe/scene was dissapointing and we paid to get into Mandalay Bay's pool the following day instead. Room service was great, yummy with some healthy options and quick. The staff seemed very helpful whenever we needed something. Love that it's directly across from Hard Rock. Also, most of the cabbies seemed to need that as a landmark reference.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Area Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: djruthie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning and right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. The rooms are modern, with ac. We had two double beds, a separate living area and gorgeous rainfall effect shower. The hotel is styled like condos with a pool, palm trees and grass area in the middle. There was always space to hang out there and I really liked the fact that it was never packed. However, they still had a bar and live dj during the day. It is a 15 minute walk up to the strip but i would defo stay here again, based on how nice the pool area was, followed by the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I have had in Vegas in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Evi1Weevi1
Reviews.Content: There are very few bad things I would have to say about my most recent trip to Vegas, and even less bad to say about the Rumor. First off, excellent location. The Strip has become an absolute nightmare to traverse. The Rumor is just off the strip enough to be outside of the gridlock but close enough to walk (or take a very cheap cab ride to!) Next, while the Rumor is an older motel that has been gutted and retrofitted into a boutique hotel, the new look is so hot it burns your retina just by looking at it. As far as the staff is concerned, they are the absolute top of the heap as far as customer service goes. I have never felt so taken care of as I have at the Rumor. Every little thing was taken care of, most of the time without me nor my companion needing to say anything. There were very few things that were not terrific about our stay, the paint was quite new in our room and there was a definite fresh paint smell everywhere in the building we were in. Also, I nearly lost a fight with the ultra modern shower controls trying to find the temperature I was comfortable with. Outside of that, an absolute dream and we have already booked our next week there! By far the best experience I have had in Vegas in over a decade!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place !!”
Reviews.Author: SANCAMPAR77
Reviews.Content: My g.f and I stayed her for the weekend and we loved our room, it was really nice , very modern and chic , the tub inside the room was very big and the bed was soooooo comfy , wish i had one like that, I must say i do miss it, the only problem we encountered was that our room was not made one day, even tho we called front desk to let them know , still came back at night and was not made but it wasn't a big deal since we aren't messy , they did apologize for the situation, also in our first room the water from the tub was not really running , just took one call and front desk switched us and upgraded our room, awesome . I would love to stay here again and get one of there suites , I can only imagine how nice those are!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new spot in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: trojanpitts
Reviews.Content: The rumor was exactly what we were looking for after a crazy EDC weekend. The room was large and beautiful, rainfall showers, free internet, and a small private balcony. The room service took awhile, but the food was fantastic and the drinks were stiff, they even threw in a free margarita for the wait! The pool area was also great, cabanas to relax in and beautiful music all day and night. We can't wait to come back and see what some of the other suites are like. Thanks Rumor for completing a weekend we'll never forget!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful but interesting place.”
Reviews.Author: rykkilynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful rooms, which is why we decided to stay there for a last-minute mostly unplanned trip to Vegas. My husband and I are not the type of hip or trendy people that the hotel is meant to attract, but we decided to stay there anyway. The other reviews about the music blaring all the night are not exaggerating at all. We weren't out partying at the pool and somehow did manage to eventually get to sleep on Saturday night though. Sunday night there was no music, so we enjoyed it more. Our first room, a Junior Suite, had a soak tub which I was really looking forward to, but the air conditioning unit was broken. They came to look at it right away and offered to either waive the resort fee or switch us rooms. We decided to switch rooms, but it meant a room without the soak tub. The bath products are nice, and the rainfall showers are a treat. The hotel is not really our usual type of place, but we knew that when we selected and decided it would be an interesting experience. We were also able to watch a short wedding that took place just outside the balcony of our second room. It is mostly valet parking (complimentary) with a small self-park lot that was usually full.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place (South Beach in Vegas)”
Reviews.Author: lvtola
Reviews.Content: This hotel is uber trendy, its just like being in South Beach, had a great time and the service was awesome. Especially Brittany at the front desk who helped us with some special room requests. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: mkhowe
Reviews.Content: I was happy to see that the new Rumor Hotel allows pets and spent time researching the property. I am relocating to Reno and will be spending one night in Las Vegas on my drive with my small, well attended feline. I love a good restaurant and pool and thought this would be a fun place. The web site clearly states that it it pet friendly and it is represented as such on trip advisor and Expedia. I could easily have made my reservation and arrived with my cat, expecting to be welcomed. It was fortunate that I called to confirm the pet policy because I was told by a hurried but nice phone rep, Lauren, that cats are not allowed. She added that this must be some kind of "bizarre corporate policy" and that she has several cats herself, which I appreciate, but do not consider to be a satisfactory answer to what is clearly a misrepresentation of hotel policy. No manager was available to talk with me.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and intimate right off the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Kilted_0ne
Reviews.Content: What a great Hip Hotel right off the strip! Perfect place to get away from being treated like cattle and more like a person. And loved being away from the Din of slot machines! Relaxing and reviving! Loved the rooms; Great Beds, rain showers and Loved the fragrance of the bath products! Defiantly the place to get away from the strip and be right next to it. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZE off strip hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RandyBlackSrCOO
Reviews.Content: We checked in on the Sunday of Memorial Day Weekend, expecting it to be hectic. There was a DJ in the lobby (awesome!) and the front desk staff was fantastic. We even got upgraded to a Deluxe Suite--thanks Allen! The only downside was that we arrived later in the day and there were no roll-away beds left (I work in a hotel, so I understood that they are on a first come, first serve basis). We got to the room, and WOW! One of the nicest, trendiest, sexiest rooms I've EVER stayed in. The bed was beyond comfy, and the bathroom was very sleek and modern. We got 2 free drinks by booking on their website, and when we got to the bar/lounge, we were amazed yet again. Drinks were delicious and reasonably priced, especially for Las Vegas. All in all, it was a fabulous trip and I'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Off-the-Strip Stay”
Reviews.Author: genland18
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Rumor Hotel over the Memorial Weekend. I frequent Vegas a lot and usually stay on the Strip or on Fremont Street, and usually in "no-frills" casino hotels, as I prefer convenience of the location rather than a fancy room. But after seeing a story on the hotel last year, I thought I'd try something different. The hotel is quite trendy and caters to a younger audience. When we got in at noon on Saturday, the music at the pool was blaring full blast. We could hear the bass in our room, which was towards the end of the resort. Surprisingly, the pool was closed and the place fairly quiet during the evening hours. The hotel is still trying to find its groove among the young party-goers. It didn't seem too packed, either by the pool during the day, nor the bar late at night. And this was a holiday weekend! We stayed in a Deluxe Simple Suite with two queen beds. The rooms were stylishly designed in purple and white. The beds and pillows were heavenly! The couch in the living room area wasn't all that comfortable, so I mostly spent time in their comfy beds. There is indeed an adult channel (Channel 69) available, which was amusing, as most of it seemed to be dated from the 80s or 90s. It was also nice to not have to walk through the labyrinth of a casino to get back to our room at night. Small gripes would be that upon arrival we had no TV remote for the bedroom or living room, and when we tried to call the front desk, we discovered the phone didn't work. Thankfully, it didn't take too long for maintenance to rectify our issues. Also, the ice machine located in our building never worked during our entire stay, and we didn't feel motivated to go searching another building for a one that functioned. Valet was hard to track down upon our arrival, and when we were ready to grab a taxi and hit the strip, they were too busy with incoming guests. We ended up walking to the Hard Rock across the street, which was no big deal. I had read that there used to be a no food/drink policy for the rooms, but this has since been lifted. All in all, it was a fun to try out, but it probably won't be my "go-to" choice, as I prefer the convenience of staying right on the Strip or on Fremont Street. I may look into it again if I ever have a specific need to see a concert at the Hard Rock, or if the price is right for my travel dates.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Wedding we could ask for. Rumor Staff = Family”
Reviews.Author: TonyL78
Reviews.Content: First off, if I could give RUMOR 10 STARS I would. My Fiance and I were looking for a place to hold out Big Day (Wedding) and we were searching places in our home town of Boston when we finally agreed it would make better sense to hold our wedding in Vegas, since most of our friends now reside in California and Las Vegas. Having nearly 20 long vacations in Las Vegas personally (my best friend/best man resides there), I had a good idea of which venues to look at. Then, a curveball happened. We came across Rumor Boutique online. Judging by the website this had everything we were looking for. It is hip, hot, and close to the strip. My best man made a stop by and said it was awesome. Then, our wedding photographer called us from Vegas, while doing another photo shoot in Vegas and did a recon mission himself. He called us at 3 am EST and said we were going to LOVE RUMOR. So far so good. Little did I expect when we got there just how much RUMOR WOULD BLOW US AWAY. Let me start by saying that the communication of the Events Director Susan Hall and the wedding coordinator Joni Mitchel was on another level. Being 3,000 miles away and coordinating your wedding can make a stressful situation worse, however this was not the case. The immediate and thorough communication that these two amazing woman maintained with us during the entire process was the equivalent to speaking to them in person. OUTSTANDING is the only word that comes to mind. It gets better. My first day there, I bumped into this strapping young lad of a Food and Beverage Director by the name of Benjamin Ortiz. We immediately connected on multiple levels due to the fact that Ben is originally from Queens. Several Yankees and Red Sox jabs later and it's safe to say that not only did BEN ORTIZ and KATIE CALVERT help make our Wediing the GREATEST DAY OF OUR LIVES, but they also became family to us. You see that is what separates Rumor from any other wedding venue that I or any of our friends or family have attended before. THEY CARE. THEY MAKE SURE THAT YOU NOT ONLY GET WHAT YOU WANT, BUT THEY MAKE YOU NEVER WANT TO LEAVE. fROM THE CLEANING CREW, TO THE OWNERS, they all know who you are and genuinely care and love their jobs. It is the most professional AND most relaxed environment any of us have ever been to. My God! I forgot the FOOD! To die for. The rehearsal dinner we had a gathering of close to 20 people and many of our friends and family are already married. They said it was by far THE GREATEST MEAL THEY HAD EVER HAD AT A WEDDING. The Chef and staff comes out to also make sure that everything is to your liking. Carey the bartender is the man. No if ands or buts. One of the best bartenders in Vegas. Jonathon from security is the MAN! Heart of Gold. BOTTOM LINE. The entire wedding party is already rebooking for next May to return to Rumor. We are going to turn it into an annual tradition for our group of 40 to return to Rumor and there is a reason for that. RUMOR = HOME To Susan, Joni, Carey, John, Katie and BEN. You just added 40 people to your family, and if you visit us, you have a family in Boston waiting to see you. GO TO RUMOR AND THANK ME LATER. You might just create a life long bond with truly amazing and gifted people.

Reviews.Title: “They over charged us 3 nights..... where is my refund???”
Reviews.Author: bourdin3
Reviews.Content: I don't have words to describe my experience in the Rumor Hotel. People sleeping in my room, music in the pool starts at 6:00 AM in the morning, etc.... Finally, they over charged us.....3 nights. I've called and emailed many times about the matter, I've sent my credit card extract.....But I never received a email or call back !! Only a refund of one night to another credit card !!! but where is my refund for the other 2 nights?? Today I've sent another email to the Rumor Hotel, I expect that the manager reads this message and solve it a soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: JulieChambers
Reviews.Content: So happy to be there. It great looking, the room was comfortable, the valets were wonderful and the food was WOW! Seriously, took us by surprised. We ordered breakfast and ate it by the pool. The waiter was really nice. We could not believe how good the food was. Probably the best meal we had in Vegas! The potatoes were wonderful, the fruit fresh, and the unlimited coffee delicious! This place is an undiscovered oasis. Our friends stayed at Ceasar's which was smokey and twice as much $ and they had to rush to get up early to reserve a bad place at the pool. No problem at Rumor! We even watched two weddings there, too. The phone system was a bit complicated, but we didn't care that much about that. We had our cell phones. And we didn't have the best view in the house, either. But we got a great rate and we were very happy we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value I've Found in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: djkeb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had tickets to see Tiesto on the 7th and I was stoked when I remembered the little hotel that we saw last time we were at Hard Rock. I looked it up and was amazed by the prices for a weekend night. I've stayed at all the big ones on the strip and been to Vegas plenty of times so I'm over the whole stay on the strip scene right now. It's all about value and Rumor has the best value I've found so far. We only stayed for the night but enjoyed the pool for most of the day before we could check in at 4. I'm a dj so I rather enjoyed the music and the service of the waitress. It wasn't very crowded but I'm already set with my own lady so the amount of people doesn't matter much to me. The rooms were nice and worth every dollar. The tub wasn't holding water and first but a maintenance man came and fixed it right away. The Hard Rock is right across the way so finding a cab isn't tough and neither is gambling. OHHH, we had food at the pool and it was awesome. Compliments to the chef for my burger. I really enjoyed the room and my girlfriend loved it too. So much that were heading back there in June for EDC. It's gonna be wild!

Reviews.Title: “Overall LOVED my stay just a few complaints...”
Reviews.Author: koolaid_5
Reviews.Content: First thing this place is everything I had been looking forward to for my 21st birthday! Modern, hip, and intimate. One of the things that really was disappointing was that I had been planning on eating dinner at the Addiction restaurant in the hotel and because there was a wedding the whole restaurant was reserved for the event. I would have liked some kind of advance notice to plan accordingly. The next morning I was planning on going to breakfast there and apparently on Sundays they only serve "brunch" which is a buffet and honestly paying for a buffet is a waste of money for me. Overall I was disappointed that I was unable to ever get to the restaurant that I had been looking forward to. The concierge was the BOMB and totally hooked us up! The feather pillows and king bed were a dream to fall into after a long night. SO close to the Vanity night club and took a nice walk up to the strip. I really love this hotel and plan on staying there again :)

Reviews.Title: “I rate this a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappyLee63
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I recently spent three days and nights at this charming hotel. Ben Ortiz, the manager, and his attentive staff, catered to all our requests. The suite was luxurious, clean and comfortable. A large pool, umbrellas and beach towels were at our disposal. The food was gourmet quality at peasant prices. My travels have taken me to many hotels and I can honestly give Rumor 5 stars. I am looking forward to spending two weeks there in 2012. Another big plus are the affordable room rates..

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: jill0112358
Reviews.Content: I was super-excited for our visit to Rumor Las Vegas for a friend's 40th birthday. The prices were reasonable and the rooms and grounds looked stunning on-line. We didn't necessarily want to stay in a casino nor in a "family" hotel. Prior to arrival I had called to ask about the differences in rooms and to inquire about an upgrade - after making my reservation on-line a month before. The front-desk person on the phone couldn't answer any of my questions and really didn’t seem interested in helping me upgrade to a better room. There was no wait to check in, but we had problems with our first room. We had requested a "patio' and were given a 2nd story room. Our phone didn't work. We returned to the lobby and were assigned a new room on the first floor. A bottle of wine was waiting for the birthday boy in the reserved room, which was a really nice gesture. We had to sign a waiver that no outside food or drink was to be brought in yet 20 minutes later guests were being taken to their room by staff with the luggage cart filled with a cooler and bags of food. I asked about the policy and was told by management that they couldn't really enforce it. There is no fridge in the room so we had to improvise with the "ice in the sink" bottle chiller method. We had no tub in our room - just a "rain" (more accurately "mist") shower with weak water pressure. The water-closet door was hung askew and wouldn’t latch closed. We requested an iron, an ironing board, additional hangers and additional towels (to accommodate the 4-guest occupancy that we had reserved and paid for) and these were delivered to us. I was never able to connect to WiFi from the room or from the lobby. On the plus side, the beds and linens were comfortable. Service varied. One morning we sat ourselves for breakfast and walked out about 15 minutes later as we had been ignored by staff. There were a couple of people seated at the bar and that was it. The bartender wouldn't acknowledge us nor would any other staff walking past. Other times Ben made sure we were well taken care of in the restaurant. The valets were friendly and it was easy to walk out and get a cab. It was a cold, windy November weekend that we were there so we couldn't enjoy the pool. We nicknamed Rumor the "coke and poke". While the décor was new and hip the generally feel was kind of sleazy. It is probably a fun place to party but we were disappointed with the overall quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rumor is an experience as soon as you walk in the door!! The colors and swanky decor are too much fun. Staff was friendly and professional up through the mamagement. Bartenders mix a mean drink and are great fun. Loved my room, absolutely gorgeous, clean and great amenities (love the fragrance of the lotion). Look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: j0sie55
Reviews.Content: I really liked the room and comfy bed. Staff was great, especially Ben. Food was good. We asked for a frig and got one right away. There was only a couple of problems, one was our non-working telephone (which we reported right away but no one fixed) and the first night, music from the outdoor patio speakers played quite late. We were told they forgot to turn them off and we should have phoned, well we had no working phone. Also there was cleaning staff vacuuming late at night which did disturb us. They tried to call us on the 2nd night to give us a free upgrade to a suite with a bottle of wine, but our phone was not working and sadly we did have to leave for home. I would stay here again though, as these were minor things.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Guest85226
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days at this hotel and it was great! Rumor is very hip and chic with a fun atmosphere, amazingly friendly staff and great rooms. We got there late on Friday night and the valet, Brandon, was right there when we pulled up, very friendly and assisted us with our bags before taking the car. The front desk agent, Jose, greeted us immediately, was super friendly and got us checked in very quickly. We got to our room and it was perfect! I am a bit of a hotel snob and this hotel passed all of my "room inspection" for cleanliness. The bed is comfortable with great pillows. We had a pool view room and it was so nice being able to sit out on the patio. The housekeeping staff is fantastic and our room was always very well cleaned and stocked. This hotel is a must stay if you want to be close to the strip but feel like you are a world away. The pool area is VERY nice with lots of room, comfortable lounges and sun beds along with cabanas. They offer a poolside bar and there is a DJ on the weekend playing music.

Reviews.Title: “I like techno as much as anyone, but that was a bit much”
Reviews.Author: BigTMcB
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't what we reserved online, which was fine. getting a cab was tricky since about half the time there weren't valets at the desk, but we just walked over to the hard rock to grab one. The restaurant closed promptly at 11, which was a little strange since we were at a boutique hotel and were hoping that they could serve us at 11:15, but i get that. I don't get the techno music though. starting at 10 AM both friday and saturday, they blared music from the pool. i assume it was for ambiance but since there were only 2 people at the pool it seemed a little over done. and it didn't stop until 6PM. with no one at the pool. either day. now, i like house music as much as any one not in a nightclub, but it made for a tough day to rest up for the night. probably not going back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brittneyjae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at rumor for the first time for new years eve... Which was almost a disaster.... We had plumbing issues with our room and had to be moved to 3 different rooms over a 2 night stay... I was so excited because the place was so beautiful but there were so many issues with the hotel and management I just wasn't satisfied they ended up giving me a free 2 nights the next time I decided to stay there.... 3 months later in march I went back to rumor for a friends birthday and it was a totally different experience .... Different management some different staff it was amazing everything went smoothly and if anything ever went wrong I spoke directly to the general manager Matt who was amazing!!!!! He would fix anything right away... I feel like he's really attentive and I have nothing bad to say about rumor except.... That it's amazing and the only place that I will ever stay in Vegas from now on... I'll be back in may and I'm so excited to stay at rumor..

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort To Relax At”
Reviews.Author: hevidac
Reviews.Content: With a modern but artistic interior, and a beautiful courtyard, this hotel compliments itself nicely. One of the few hotels in Vegas that isn't connected to a casino, nor does it have any noisy slot machines anywhere on the premise. Some people might find it a bit far from the strip, but it's really not a far distance, and provides a nice little escape from the chaos of the strip. The staff was great too, Lauren and Alex especially. Courteous and respectful, but not ridged and stingy. They're very engaging and attentive. The hotel is pet friendly, which is pretty rare to find in Vegas, especially one that is as nice as this one. I'll be staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel without the constant racket of slot machines? I'm there.”
Reviews.Author: jbranch_la7
Reviews.Content: Rumor feels like the little Nevada cousin of The Standard in West Hollywood. Over the top, tongue-in-cheek style, but with a much friendlier staff. And thankfully not a jangling slot machine in sight. The recent renovation did well with plentiful, cushy pillows and comfy bed, modernist bathroom (but, oddly, nowhere to hang a towel), waterfall shower, and in-room jacuzzi (which I didn't use, but the yellow rubber duck was a nice touch). Restaurant food and service were enthusiastic and mostly good, if a little uneven (they're still a new crew, so I won't hold that against them). TIP: A club vibe is helped along by house music piped into the common restaurant/pool area. If you want to head to bed before 11pm, bring earplugs or request a room without that view. The only downside is the location -- far enough from the Strip, Monorail and Convention Center that a taxi ride is usually more realistic than walking. But given the reasonable room rates and calm in the middle of Vegas' usual overstimulation, that's a tradeoff I'm happy to make. Once word gets out, this place will be booked up; I just hope they'll be able to keep their chill style once they're no longer a best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Candyand008
Reviews.Content: Very modern, reminds me of a Miami Hotel. Staff was awesome. I bought off tripres.com, they had a deal $199 for 3nites in the 2rm suite! However they had overbook, so they offered us a free room at the sister hotel, we really wanted to stay at Rumors so we declined. They upgraded us to the Swinger Suite for free! WOW is all I can say. Couch n flat screen in the bathroom, 2 person shower. Huge King and 2 sofas. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Rumor”
Reviews.Author: m0xie_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Rumor for 4 nights before moving to another hotel on the Strip for the remainder of our stay in Vegas. After we left, we found ourselves wishing we had booked Rumor for our entire stay. We arrived around 1:00, so ended up having lunch at Addiction and then lounging in the hammocks until check in. There was a little wait at check in, but otherwise went smoothly. Our room was clean and comfortable, with an elevated soaking tub and a rain shower. The hotel is in the flight path for the airport, so there is a lot of air traffic, but we couldn't hear it in our room. Bed was large and comfortable. Decor throughout the property was posh and modern. The pool was under construction while we were there, which was a bummer, and I wish we would have known that in advance. The front desk did say we could show our room keys at the hotel across the street for access to their pool during our stay, although we didn't take advantage of that option. The pool area looks like it will be fabulous when it's completed. We did some relaxing in the hammocks in the courtyard a few times, which was nice in lieu of the pool. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Strip (straight up E Harmon), or about an $7-8 cab ride if you don't feel like walking. What really made our experience great was our interactions with the staff. I need to eat gluten free (no wheat or wheat flour, rye, barley), which makes eating while travelling nightmarish. Many restaurants aren't familiar with what that means, or don't understand the importance of avoiding cross contamination during prep and cooking. From our first meal at Rumor's restaurant, Addiction, Ben Ortiz assured me he understood and would notify the chef and staff of my needs. From that meal on, they went out of their way to make sure what I was eating was safe for me. They let me know what dishes were 'safe' for me to eat as they were, and which dishes could be modified so that they would be ok. We ended up eating most of our meals at Addiction during our stay, because it was the only place we encountered during our trip that I knew they really understood and were looking out for me and my health. Having worked in the food industry in the past, I know it can be a pain in the @ss to accomodate someone with a food allergy or intolerance. They really went above and beyond for me, and I can't tell you how much I appreciated the peace of mind knowing that I could eat a meal without fear of getting sick. (Also, my husband and I both thought the food was all great, and reasonably priced.) In addition to Ben, Victor and Katie also made our experience more pleasurable, with Victor also watching out for my gluten-free needs, and both Victor and Katie recommending some delicious cocktails for us throughout our stay. The personal advantage of staying in a boutique hotel was magnified by our interactions with these three, in particular. We did notice a few hiccups throughout our stay that seemed to be related to new staffing, but overall, we thought Rumor was a great value and we would definitely stay there again the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This is an upscale version of Motel 6 with ZGalleri decor.”
Reviews.Author: Daisy4yoo
Reviews.Content: This is not your regular Vegas hotel. As you enter the lobby, it is a combination of check ins/out, bar, dance room, lounge/dining area; it's a multi-purpose room. This place does not have an elevator, so be sure when you come here with a load of luggages, ask for the first floor. The room itself, is not what you would expect if you were to stay at other hotels in Vegas. It is the same layout as you would see at Super Motel 8 or Motel 6. Although, I do think, a regular Motel would have a fridge, this place doesn't. It doesn't have a tub, so it's not a full bathroom. The room is functional but lack convenience because everything is still manual except for TV & AC. This hotel is good for rest only and avoiding the crowds as it does not have casinos & a lot of amenities that other Vegas hotel offers. No self-park; valets only.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Accommodating!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrboxx
Reviews.Content: For some reason when I checked in, Fo who was working the front desk at the time didn't honor the arrangements that my assistant book. It was only to give me a room with a balcony. The next day we spoke to Tim and he more than made everything right. From comping a night changing my room and willing to cover breakfast. (he actually informed Ben and he took care of some drinks we had.) Even Trevor was very helpful. I should be in vegas in in Aug so Rumor should be in the top 5.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Staff was the only acceptable aspect- but I didn't have a car.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4703
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel stays in about two years- Either the computer or the desk staff was incompetent. After checking in and dragging my luggage to the room, I found someone else already checked in to that room. Dragged the luggage back to the front desk, and waited behind a woman requesting toilet paper for her room. They gave me a new room, dragged the luggage there, key cards didn't work, dragged the luggage back to the desk. They reprogrammed the keys, and I dragged again; all I heard was a "Sorry 'bout that". The phone in the room didn't work- it could only dial "0", so I couldn't dial housekeeping when they didn't bother to make up the room one day. The bar-type lock on the door was broken; looked like someone had kicked in the door and knocked it completely off. When you check in, you must sign off on the rules that include no outside food or drink in the room. Can't order a pizza; can't get some takeout on your way back to the hotel at night. Valet staff was very helpful and humorous, though; good guys. Wish I had brought a car for them to park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the 25-35 age group.”
Reviews.Author: DupontTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night before joining my wife on the strip for the rest of my stay. For a 45 y/o single guy on business this was a little much, but for a couple or group in their 20's or30's this is heaven. The pool complex is going to be sweet when done. Nice pools and cabanas. The crowed seemed young and hip. They put me in the swingers sweet. It felt odd all by myself but would have rocked if my wife was with me. Nice location close to the strip but far enough away to not seem crowded. Across from HR was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: italygirl1224
Reviews.Content: Rumor is located off the strip right across the street from Hard Rock. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Strip. I went with 5 other friends, and we got 2 2-bed suites. The rooms were incredibly clean and accommodating. The beds were comfortable. I was a little worried because the hotel is right in the flight path of the airport, but once I was in the room, I did not hear the planes that much. The staff here rocked and were incredibly helpful and they always seemed to be in a good mood. There were only 2 things that I did not like about this place- 1) the shower had very little water pressure, so for girls with thick hair- showers took forever. The bathroom was pretty, just not 100% functional in that regards and 2) every night there seems to be a dance party in the lobby that you have to fight through to get to your room. It is not a big lobby, so this was kind of annoying. But once you got past that, everything was fine. The pool was closed during out stay, which worked out because it wasn't as warm as it could have been, but I didn't see any notices about that on the website when I booked. I may have not stayed there if I would have known that. Overall though a very good experience. I personally prefer staying on the Strip, but would stay here again because the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: livingspearbj
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4pm to a lobby filled with guests waiting for their rooms. We were also told that our room was not ready due to late check-outs and informed that we would have to wait. We were told to have a drink or food in the lobby (no offer to comp the refreshments was made) while we waited. After waiting an hour (we were told it would be 30 - 45 minutes) and seeing that others were getting rooms, I got back in the line. The room we were assigned was 2103 (DO NOT accept that room!) The trance music from the lobby pulsates up through the floor and went until 3am on Friday night and until 2:30 am on Saturday night. The outside speakers on the patio began blairing towards our windows at 8:30 am. Other cons: No housekeeping showed on Saturday (the friends that we traveled with didn't have it at all). The phone worked inconsistently. The pool was under construction but we were not made aware of that fact until we saw for ourselves (not even at check-in). If you rent a hotel room for sleep, avoid 2103 at all cost). Cheap, uncomfortable couch in "Deluxe" room. Pros: Trendy, I suspect (based on the pulsating rave music) that if you have the means and desire to stay up all night rolling you would love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Had great expectations...but they were ruined...”
Reviews.Author: hiljayc
Reviews.Content: We were staying here at the Rumor for just one night, as the hotel we were staying at the next two nights on the strip was fully booked the first night of our vacation. I booked through Expedia.com, a website that I have booked through at least 20+ times with no problems. We didn't arrive in Vegas until 7.00pm, so were hoping the check in process would be short and sweet, and we could get out on the town. Good thing I hadn't made any reservations for dinner or a show that night, as the check in process was not a breeze, to say the least. First of all when we arrived at the hotel, there was no valet person in sight, and we couldn't seem to find any self parking either. We ended up finding a parking space in a spot with a "DO NOT PARK,....YOU MIGHT BE TOWED" sign. My boyfriend stayed in the car so that we didn't get towed, and I went to check in. When I got inside I was really impressed by the decor and atmosphere of the lobby. When I went to the front desk, and since there was no line, I was helped immediately, yet unfortunately they didn't have a reservation for me in their system. I had my confirmation from Expedia, and showed it to the front desk woman (who was very nice), the manager (Michael, who was also very nice) realized there was an issue, and left for about 20 minutes to try and resolve the problem. I had specifically mentioned to the lady that we had booked a deluxe room, and they could tell that I was getting frustrated, so they offered to put me up in the hotel next door, however if I had wanted to stay there, then I would have booked there in the first place! I asked about parking, and was told that they only had valet that weekend since they were so busy. Finally we were allowed to check in to a room, however upon entering the room, it was obvious that this was not a deluxe room, I was already on the verge of tears after all of the hassle we had gone through. Also we looked out our window at a horrible view of an empty parking lot. If they were really that busy that they had to do valet parking, then why was this lot so empty? I contacted the manager directly from my cell phone, as he gave me his business card. He was with another guest when I called, but I was told he would call me right back on the room phone. He did call me right back, but unfortunately the room phone did not work, so I couldn't answer his call. He did come to the room, and offered us $70 in food vouchers for the restaurant, and we stayed in the room. When we arrived at the restaurant there was nobody in sight, we stood there for a while, and were about to leave when a lady peaked out of the kitchen, and asked if she could help us, we asked if they were even open, she said yes. A few minutes later the hostess came out. The food at the restaurant was mediocre. Skip the appetizers, we had the tuna and the chicken satay, both were not the best, I had the burger, which I order medium, but came rare. I am not picky about this sort of thing, so ate it anyhow, it was okay. My boyfriend ordered the pork, I wish I would have too. Other than the sauce, which was over caramelized, it was delicious. Room was nice, you can tell this place has a lot of potential, but there is a lot of work to do. Oh and then on check out I was told I owed $50 more than I did, this was quickly fixed, but it is evident that these employees are all new. I don't think we will be returning to the Rumor, unless everything else in Vegas is booked.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE. PICTURES ARE DECEIVING!!!”
Reviews.Author: carolannwagner
Reviews.Content: I came to learn that every room DOES NOT have a elevated soaking tub. we DID NOT get robes in our rooms. our room was dirty. They gave my friend a key to a room that someone was already in!! staff talked down to staff in front of us. The pool WAS NOT in commission and at the end of the stay we had 70$ in resort fees that we had NO idea about!!! Cant have outside food or drinks which i find ridiculous rooms were just not clean and ice machines did not work. This place was an overall disappointment! steps aways is alexis resort with WAAAYY better prices and the deliver what they promise and the staff was very professional!! RUMOR SUCKS!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really modern and nice big tub in room for great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ravenwalker
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for my birthday and booked the room through hotels.com. When we pulled up there was no valet but we didnt care I just got my things and proceeded to check in as my boyfriend parked the car. I was able to check in at 1 which was cool. I was really impressed with the room. It was awseome. I was bummed that the pool was closed for construction but the pool at the hardrock was way nice. I had only two problems with the hotel one was the fact my room was right by the lobby and there was a dj playing until 430 am. Becuase of this there was drunk people screaming and running into my door to my room. I would request a room on the other side of the hotel. The other problem I had is I called and requested someone to open my safe because the code I entered would not work. I waited around for an hour mind you its my birthday and I am in Vegas then I walked up to the front desk and asked the manager to please have them open the safe because I had reservations for dinner. Besides these two things everything was fine. I loved the fact we could lounge in our huge tub and watch a movie. The rain shower in the bathroom was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Rumor is.......Not so Good and that is not a Rumor”
Reviews.Author: BlueKnightsRule
Reviews.Content: Should have been a clue when our cab driver was not familiar with the name of this property. When we arrived at the hotel the valet/uniform services attendant was extremely friendly and unfortunately it went downhill from there. Friendly is not a word I would use to describe the front desk person. More business like and to the point. Almost put out to have to check people in. Also this was the first time I have ever experienced having to agree that we would not bring in any food or drink from outside the property into our room. Valet took our luggage to our room and when we entered, it was clear it had not been cleaned as the bed was not made. The smell in the hallways was musty..... We were then upgraded to another room although I couldn't really see a difference. In this room the toilet paper holder had been pulled out of the wall and sitting on the flush. We left and went to the strip. We also noted that portions of the pool area appeared tobe under construction and not available for use. A few hours later we received a call from our friends who also checked in and found their room dirty with dirty towels laying on the floor. One customer was upset about the pool availability and was told they could go across the street to the Hard Rock and use their facility. Nice - not! So at this point we decided if this is any indication of our stay we needed to move to another hotel. When we got back to the hotel to discuss with the front desk there were at least 4 other people sharing very similar experiences either room not clean or room was not what was reserved. As we were headed back to our room to gather our belongings there were about 8 employees hanging out in the courtyard chatting and not engaged with any customers. While I never actually spent a night there I saw enough to know I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cool concept but not well executed”
Reviews.Author: Makena29
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about our stay at Rumor a few weeks ago but was disappointed by the clenliness (or lack thereof). The hotel exceeded some of my expectations but fell short of others. The good part: The decor is very cool, the beds are super comfortable, the location is great, and the staff was very friendly. We didn't experience any noise issues, but those who might be sensitive to noise should consider requesting a room on the other side of the pool from the lobby. We ate at the restaurant and enjoyed our food (we weren't blown away, but it was good), but found the dining room deserted almost the entire time. The bad part: Cleanliness and housekeeping were abysmal. We arrived around 7:00 pm and there were still housekeeping carts blocking the hallway, multiple ugly storage closets were left standing wide open with no one around, there was trash piled outside courtyard rooms that no one bothered to pick up, and we found garbage in the hallway outside of our room. (The front desk sent someone to pick up the garbage at our request.) Inside the room, we found towels on the couch (luckily they were clean), the carpeting was in need of vacuuming (doesn't the staff notice that dust is highly visible on dark carpet?), the tub area had a long-standing layer of dust that discouraged me from even using it, and the closet door was left wide open. I seriously doubt that they did anything more than change the sheets and put the remote control on the bedside table when they "cleaned" the room. Further, the phone didn't work unless the handset was seated in the cradle just so to charge. When the phone finally charged and we called for breakfast rooms service, our three attempts to place our order went unanswered. Finally we just went down to the restaurant in person because we assumed it was busy and found that there was only ONE table with diners. My overall recommendation is not to stay at Rumor until they hire a new housekeeping manager with some standards. Honestly, I've been to cheap road-side motels that were cleaner and more professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service with a swanky twist!”
Reviews.Author: reservoir6436
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a non casino hotel in Las Vegas and I will most definitely be back for more. Not only did the staff provide great service, the rooms were refurbished with a cool sense of style that is hip to today's fashion trend. The layout of the suite was fantastic along with their amazing shower that I looked forward too after a long night of partying Las Vegas style. I was fortunate enough to meet the General Manager Matthew Krumwiede who graciously invited us back. All in all I really enjoyed my experience at Rumor and look forward staying their summer when the pool is all refinished. A+

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: SDLeslie
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel to check in around 10pm and they told me that they were not sure if our room was clean. They called housekeeping on the radio and housekeeping told them it was done. Personally I thought it should have been cleaned hours before. We went to the room and housekeeping was still there!! We sat outside the room for 10 to 15 minutes waiting for them to finish. Finally we got into the room and were looking around. We went over to the oversized bathtub and tried finding a light switch for the light above the tub, but couldn't find it. I called down to the front desk and the guy said he didn't know, he'd have housekeeping come to our room and help. The housekeeper came and didn't know either. How do you clean a room and not know where all the light switches are?? I told him to just forget about it. Otherwise, the room was nice and different. The bed was very comfortable! Awesome decor!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amb4663
Reviews.Content: Not only is this the sexiest hotel I've ever stayed in, the level of customer service is off the charts. The rooms are beautiful, it is minutes from the strip and the staff is top notch! I've stayed at 7 different casinoes and I'll NEVER stay elsewhere. End your evening by the fire pit. Heaven...

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nesieg
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel in Las Vegas. great design that is very different,modern and stylish but also very cozy and classy. the service was outstanding thanks to Matthew Krumwiede and his staff. can't wait to return to this place again and it will always my number 1 choice in Las Vegas. planing to come back when its warmer to hang out at the great pool area .

Reviews.Title: “worst experince i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: yankeegurl
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i travel alot around the world and us so vegas is on our list at least twice a year. this hotel has potential if they fired their whole cleaning staff. we got there around 6 on a friday and there was aline outside to check in. once i got to the front i found out that they were having trouble with all reservations made online site except their direct website. so i didnt get the room that i chose, they gave me a "better room" according to them, when we went to our room it was right next to the dog park we could see it once we open the shades, and the bed sheets were disgusting. so here we go back to wait in line again to complain, by which this the first time ever that i have complain about a hotel. they moved up to upgrade deluxe suite which ended up to be smaller no tub and hbo was not working. i was tired so we left it alone. next day our room was never cleaned at all we complained three times and not even could get fresh towels. not unitl 830 right before dinner my boyfriend talked to the manager again. it was the worst hotel we have ever been to the look of the hotel is nice but i would not go back until they fix everything.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: mforniss
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel through one of the travel websites I frequently use. The photos of the hotel, the amenities, the reviews, and especially the price sold me. During the check-in, we were asked to sign a contract that we would not bring any food or drink into the hotel. The contract also stated a $250 cleaning fee if you smoke in your room. After checking in, we soon realized that we didn't get the non-smoking/pool view room that we were confirmed for through the travel website. We went back to the front desk to inquire about our room. They confirmed that they made a mistake and put us in a smoking room, apologized, and agreed to move us to a non-smoking/pool view room. Unfortunately, there weren't any available, so the manager upgraded our room at no extra charge. We were very pleasantly surprised when we walked into a beautiful suite with a sitting area, living room, pool view balcony, bedroom with a soaking tub, and large restroom with a rain shower. On the down side, our room was not cleaned the first day, but we were accomodated with fresh towels. The maids did show up on the second day, but we were in the room, so I requested them to come back. The maid basically told me that her shift was almost up. I told her that she didn't have to clean my room but requested for the trash to be emptied, fresh towels, and bath tissue. She was very accomodating. During or visit to the jacuzzi, we noticed that the property could use some keeping up. The pool beds were stained and there were empty water bottles and plastic drink cups laying around. Please also be aware that it's pretty much valet parking only. They have about 5 self parking spaces but they are always full. Overall, the decor is amazing and the service is great, and although we were asked to sign the contract about no food/drink, we brought drinks in and it was fine. We also observed other people bringing in ice chests, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for something chic and economical. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and Mirrors Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KingJamez
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the advertisements and pictures of this place you'll find on the web. From the outside you might be enticed by their so called "posh" look. But once you finally get to your room, that is if you get to it, it is probably not what you are going to expect like the experience I had! My wife and I booked a two night stay here through Hotels.com because they advertised pretty well and the pictures didn't look too shaby at all. But we shure were fooled! When we arrived it turned out check in time wasn't till 3pm and they were understaffed apparently because the bell boy/girl was doing her job and tending their ridiculous bar! Anyways, when we got to our room it was literally not cleaned; the house keeping girl was (who looked like she was 16 years of age) still cleaning up our room! This made my wife and I real disappointed. I am usually against discrimination but for this review I have to say that when I go to a hotel I expect to see housekeeping "ladies" (between her late 30's/40's) with experience not housekeeping girls who are barely 18 years of age! But going back to the room situation, we went back down to the front desk to get a new room. Once we mentioned to the front desk dude that are room wasn't even ready he put on this phony look of shock, which he probably wouldn't of displayed if there wasn't a line waiting to check in! So he told us he was sorry and gave us a new room which was supposed to be an "upgrade" from his words, trying to make us feel better. Though yet again, disapointment was on its way. The only real "upgrade" that we got in the new room is that we didn't find housekeeping in it! It was pretty much the same room as the first with just a slightly larger bed and only one dirty towel left in it! We tried our hardest to make the most of what we got for our money but in the end we still got ripped off on our $120 stay for two nights. So don't be fooled about this joke of a hotel. The only "Rumor" about this hotel that should be floating around is how bad it is! And it shure as hell aint no "Boutique"!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: az333
Reviews.Content: I just love,love,love this hotel!!!!!!love the design,love the rooms,love the pool, love the bar,love the service and thanks GM Matthew being so helpful

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Drizz1129
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at the Rumor last weekend for a special anniversary. I really wish we wouldn’t have given them a chance! When we arrived, they were nice enough to upgrade us to a room facing the courtyard. Sweet! We were just going to drop off our stuff, then head out for the day. When we got to the room, there were no tissues, toilet paper, and no robes like we were told were included in the resort fee. So a call to the front desk, saying we were just leaving and if they could leave them in the room for us would be great. No big deal. We return to change for dinner 3 hours later, and nothing was done. Annoying, but still no big deal. Another call to the desk and a promise to send it up right away. We left for dinner for the night thinking all was set. When we returned for the night much later, still nothing. I headed to the desk to ask in person, and they assured me it would be sent up right away. Eventually it arrived, but it took 3 requests for things that should have already been in the room! We decided to meet some friends at the bar for a night cap. There was some sort of party going on in the restaurant/bar/lobby area which was fine, we would take our drinks outside next to the fire pit and enjoy the outside seating area. I approached the bar, and was ignored for a few minutes even though there are 2 bartenders working and the bar is fairly small. A guy pushed his way in front of me and shouted his drink order to the bartender, and he quickly made his drink while still ignoring me. When I gave the guy a frustrated look, he told me not to give him attitude, because his friends had rented out the whole bar, and I should be lucky enough to be allowed to hang out with them. The bartender heard this and just laughed and laughed, while still ignoring my attempts to order a few drinks. We left, headed over to the Hard Rock and tried to forget about Rumor. We returned around 2am to find neighbors smoking pot on their balcony and carrying on pretty loudly. The walls in this place are paper thin; you can literally hear quiet, normal conversations as if they are taking place in your room. We wouldn’t mind the noise at midnight, but at 4am, we were over it. Attempting to call the front desk was useless, as the phone in the room doesn’t work. I called from my cell phone, and after 5 minutes of back and forth with the operator, she finally understood that I was actually a guest IN the hotel. When their security finally arrived, instead of knocking on their door, he shouted at them from the courtyard. Seriously? They talked for a good 10 minutes.
