Finally the music turned down, and we were able to get a few hours of sleep while on a contact high from our neighbors pot wafting into our room. When we woke up we packed and left. I wanted to discuss some of these issues with the front desk, but I handed over my keys and received “Doyouneedacopyofyourrecipt?No? NEXT!” The rooms are cool, and the price is right, but don’t rely on service or amenities. The noise from the planes is LOUD as well. A few times I though I was hearing planes, but really it was the laundry carts rolling through the courtyard on the concrete - they are as loud as the planes are! I guess I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like RUMOR!!”
Reviews.Author: Mzdeeva7
Reviews.Content: So... this is my FIRST time in Vegas and I didn't want the look of a standard hotel room that was super expensive just because it was on the strip. So I lucked up coming across this hotel on the internet. It was the colors that caught my eye. But boy was I in for a surprise when I got here... when we walked in, the chic look and swank boutique style was quite impressive. It was bold it was edgy, it was different. The actual 5 stars are really dedicated to the management and staff. From the valet to the front desk we were greeted with a smile and an "un-rehersed" good afternoon and welcome. Everything came natural. I cannot say enough good things about Matthew K. the GM. He is the posterchild for customer service at its best! There was no accommodation he could not meet, and never once were we treated like guests in his presence...he treated us like FAMILY. Everytime he saw us he made it his business to stop and talk to us, ask if we needed anything, gave us suggestions on where to go and what to do. He really made this trip extra special for me and from the bottom of my heart I want to give a big THANK YOU for everything. You are one in a million and every establishment should have a Matthew K. There were other stars as well like our breakfast buddy Jama, the wonderful chef Derrick that came out to greet us AND gave me a recipe that my kids will love. My all time favorite bar stars Carey and Brian who knew exactly what we wanted and were great at what they do(thanks for the fresh strawberry daiquiri..no mix needed! @Carey) We tested this hotel at every level from front desk to security to housekeeping to room service to the restaurant and bar and everyone passed with flying colors. For those of you complaining about the hotel I think you should check your reservations again because that CANNOT be the same place that I stayed. And if it is, I would say give them another chance! I am rebooking my next stay before I leave today. TAKE A BOW RUMOR STAFF...CONGRADULATIONS ON A JOB WELL DONE! Mrs. Correy B.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation gone awry”
Reviews.Author: glocal-citizen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Feb, 2011. What attracted my husband and I was the location of this hotel (paradise road), which is very near the boulevard and other casinos on the strip. What we didn't know was the bad housekeeping, noisy club/lounge/lobby (situated right outside the rooms), inconvenient parking would come along with its convenient location! We feared our return to the hotel every night as we had to go past a very, very crowded night club and sleeping in the rooms felt as if we were partying along with the crowd! Impossible to catch a wink after the exhausting walk down the strip... Would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff...”
Reviews.Author: williebell08
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel and was taken buy the the valet person he was very nice. Once inside the lobby was amazing as the pictures online. The staff from the front desk person patrick and one of the mangers ben had the best customer service ive ever recieved. and i travel 8 months out of year in and out of hotel. the rooms are amazing the view of the strip. The courtyard was amazing with the pools and palm trees and outside lounge area. This was my wife first time coming to vegas and was scared she would miss out on staying on the strip. I promise ill never stay anywhere else in vegas as long as im paying or have say so my business will always come to the rumor. And last the new general manger has this place going to the top his charcter the way he treated us and the guess we had with us was above and beyond hats of to youMatthew Krumwiede and your staff job greatly done.....

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW FAVORITE PLACE TO STAY IN VEGAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: PokerGirls
Reviews.Content: This Newly rennovated boutique hotel is JUST WHAT VEGAS HAS BEEN NEEDING! I stayed here for ten days with my 3 dogs while recovering from surgery, and it was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had.  Unless you bring a pet, you would never know you're in a pet friendly hotel -the rooms are as clean and fresh as can be and everything is so comfortable you almost feel at home in the deluxe suites.  If you are traveling with a pet, I dare you to find another posh spot that is so comfortable and accomodating for you and your furry friends! First of all, my pooches are NOT the most popular breeds in relations to people - most Chihuahua's and miniature pinschers end up in the pounds! Mine can be skittish at times, especially around men, but they were greeted by Matthew the magnetic dog-loving General Manager, and given such a warm greeting that I was scared they were going to run home with him instead of staying with me! When it comes to pet-lovers, Matthew is in the top 1%, so you can be sure you're in the right hands at Rumor! The dog run with fake fire hydrant is a hoot and the boys loved going in there and doing their business several times a day. Never did I ever feel I was an inconvenience on any of the staff or guests for having dogs. I - and I'm sure they as well! - can't wait to go back and stay at Rumor!  There are really so many wonderful things to say about this place in comparison to the casino hotel experience, it makes reviewing the hotel difficult in less than 1000 words! The Valet guys are MAGNIFICIENT & Dog lovers as well! There's no reason to park your car yourself because Kyle & friends have their pulse on everything you need. Also, its so much easier to just get out of the front door of the hotel than your large casinos - and THAT is a breath of fresh air!  The $50 a day refundable incidental charge is actually laughable. I thought it was unnecessarily laughable in the beginning, then laughable when I left because I think I spent more money on the food and hanging out with Ben - the restaurant manager - than I did on the room! The food & dining experience alone deserve their own separate review - no joke. I actually live in vegas and since I had all of my girlfriends visiting me and dining with me, they are constantly bugging me to go back on a daily basis because the "mac Styx" (basically xxxtra large cheese stick-looking things that are filled with yummy penne mac & cheese!) have become a severe addiction for all of us! Hmmmm....maybe THATS why thats the name of the restaurant! Hahaha! The TAPATIZERS are all "to die for", but if you want the honest truth about anything on the menu, just ask Ben Ortiz and he will set you and your friends up with one of the greatest dining experiences you can have in vegas! They have happy hour specials on TAPATIZERS, but I would have gladly GLADLY paid twice the price instead of half! Yes, people!, they are THAT GOOD! Try the "Short & Sweet" and the "Waldorf Salad" is amazing, too! I ate one every day! Breakfast is ridiculous. I don't eat eggs, but Rumor can change all of that - even in me! Their "scramble" is amazing and don't even mention the breakfast sliders - a culinary feat like no other!!! Basically, just go see Ben & you'll see for yourself! I'm making "Addiction" @ rumor my favorite new vegas eatery! Now I would like to comment on some other reviews at this point - ones that I'd read before I stayed at rumor. Basically, this is not your grandma's hotel - well, it can be, if you have an awesome Hip Granny. Of course there is music and there is noise - hello People! You came to vegas for peace and quiet? Give me a break. Who actually does that, truthfully, anyway. The place is new, clean, the beds are comfortable & they have down pillows! Matthew is very attentive and eager to cater to your every whim! I felt like I was in a more intimate version of a two-story "Four Seasons" when it came to service and hospitality! The staff really believe in what they are representing and the energy in this place is clean and wholesome - unlike MANY of the casinos you can stay in in vegas. Basically, for me, there will never be another option but Rumor & since I know they are accommodating to parties and weddings, I think I'll be having a birthday party there soon! For all of you action junkies - There's a really loud casino right across the street if you need your big time gambling fix. Rumor is the place you'd actually want to STAY in!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and Torn”
Reviews.Author: HMMecham
Reviews.Content: Please read the whole thing. I think this hotel has potential but we didn't have a very good stay with them. My husband and I booked this hotel, not having ever heard of it. Up front the hotel looks great. Small, easy to get around and it looks just as fun and modern as the pictures. First off there was a huge party going on in the lobby, which was fine no big deal other than it was really loud and we could here it in our building ( 3 buildings away). We got to our room and it was dirty. The floors were NOT vacumned the floor in the bathroom hadn't been swept, there was something smeared on the door to the bathroom and cigarrette ashes in the ash tray outside still. And there were ashes in the drawers. Our phone didn't work at all so I had to call the number from my own phone in the morning and ask for housekeeping to come clean. Well we were gone all that day and came back to a still dirty room. So I went and talked to the front desk, who was very nice and had housekeeping go up and clean. And I talked to the GM who compensated us for the hassel. So my husband and I waited outside till we saw the housekeeper come back. And we went up and the floors were still a mess, we didn't have anything taken care of but our bed made with new sheets and new towels put in the bathroom. It was really frustrating. Luckily that was our last night and we decided we would take care of it in the morning when we checked out. We ate at Addiction (the restaurant) that morning and the food was great presented beautifully and very filling. Then we proceeded to check out and found out there was a $35 charge for "Resort Fees" for access to the pool and internet, the valet service they provide and a bunch of other stuff that we were told was free upfront when we got there - which was aggrivating to not know that beforehand. All in all I am really disappointed with this hotel. I think they have a lot going for them but are lacking in some areas as well. The valet parking was nice to have, Addiction the restaurant was great, the rooms were put together nicely and the bathroom was fun and modern with a bowl sink and a rain shower head. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the bed and pillows were really comfortable. Housekeeping was terrible.. worst I've ever seen in all my traveling, the hidden fees were frustrating and the hotel is right by the airport which is noisy since the planes come in right over head. I wish this could have been a better experience for us. I thought this place had true potential for the price. Sadly I was let down. Hopefully they get it together soon with the help of the new GM.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!! Mathew K. was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: ediamond
Reviews.Content: What a cute hotel. The decorating and look of the rooms and outdoor area is very hip and clean. Mathew K. was so great!! He really went above and behond to treat us well and make us feel important. The restraunt was delicious. They have Mac and Cheese stixs!! SOOOO GOOOOD!! Drinks were VERY reasonably priced. We will definally be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vday Weekend Surprise Motel 6 Outside, Posh Inside”
Reviews.Author: SonyaStew
Reviews.Content: First Impression: We just arrived at the Motel 6 Second Impression: Modern, Chic and Gorgeous Pros: Hotel staff is friendly and professional from the front desk to the valet & housekeeping. There was a DJ the last night 2/13 they had our attention for 3-4 hours, he should be a staple. The Hotel is right across from the yummy Hard Rock Cafe, Around the corner from Subway, a Market, CVS, Chinese, Dim Sum, etc. By Vegas walking standards you can easily walk to the strip (10-15 minutes). Cons: The hotel charges a refundable per night deposit of $50.00 but does not include that information in their confirmation. (So my complaint is not about the reasonable deposit but the fact they hide what every other hotel discloses upfront) The iron/board is not located in the room and must be requested.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Eatingguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a night club that plays music all night. The bass shakes the entire hotel and it's impossible to sleep. It's like your room is the dance floor, and it doesn't matter where in the hotel your room is located. You still hear and feel the music. Plus, our room was not ready when promised and we did not get the room we reserved.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Jmhar2002
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The decor, the service, the food and the value were all top notch. I can't wait to come back during the summer and enjoy the beautiful pool. Although the pool and hot tub are open in the winter...the weather was a bit chilly during our stay. I used to live in Vegas so I have stayed at a lot of Las Vegan hotels (the Artisan, the Venetian, New York New York, the Trump and the Stratosphere) but this place is my favorite! My fiance and I had an amazing dinner here for 1/3 of strip prices. Front desk, valet and bellman service was top notch. The place was very empty during our 3 night stay over Super Bowl weekend so sometimes there was wait staff other times not...but the resturant was open whever we were hungry. If they didn't have a server then the bar staff filled in. During the winter months it is ideal for any kind of travelers (even families with kids that want a pool to themselves) but with the warmer weather expect a wilder crowd, pool parties and loud music. If any of that bothers you then, what are you doing in Vegas ;) ? I only hope that when this place is discovered that the level of service won't be too compromised!

Reviews.Title: “Rumor Steals the Show!”
Reviews.Author: MrValdi
Reviews.Content: Rumor was a diamond in the rough on our recent trip to Las Vegas. My fiancée and I stayed at Rumor for 3 nights. It was our secret getaway from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The ability to come back to our hotel after a day on the strip and just relax was amazing. The rooms were incredible and the service all around from check in to the restaurant was amazing. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds i have ever seen in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vadimash
Reviews.Content: I loved to be arround Las Vegas on my trip to California+Nevada,from all hotels i've stayed on my 2 weeks trip,best quality sleep i ever had,For sure will be back next time,we loved your jacuzzi....

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: kimmyd_11
Reviews.Content: We had our daughter's wedding reception at this hotel and had the best time - it made an already great day perfect. Susan the event planner was more than helpful with the planning as my daughter lives in the UK and did everything from there and Ben was just the best. He was so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We had a selection of appetizers when we arrived which were amazing - the Kobe sliders were to die for!!! We also had a two hour drinks package which was unbelievable value for money. We reserved the private dining area for our main meal which was great and my husband said the steak was one of best he had ever had!! We have never been to Vegas before and we did look at having this event in one of the big hotels but we are so pleased we didn't. We cannot recommend this hotel and restaurant highly enough and want to thank everyone there for just giving us the greatest time.

Reviews.Title: “Rumor Has It”
Reviews.Author: LaceyLV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Rumor several times with my boyfriend but after my last stay I decided I needed to write a review. I LOVE this hotel. I live in Vegas and usually like to try all of the different hotels but ever since my first stay at Rumor I haven't found a reason to stay anywhere else. The staff is always so friendly, my first stay the valet walked with me all the way to my room and took my luggage for me. The front desk is always very polite and accomodating. I've never been denied a late check out, unlike the Hard Rock where they surprised me with a $100 late check out fee. Rumor has the best courtyard with a charming pool and cozy hammocks all around the area. The decor of the lobby and lounge area is trendy and unique. The suites are beautiful and include unique touches like a fresh orchid(my favourite flower!), and a rubber ducky in the huge tub. I recommened this hotel every chance that I get! This last stay was the first time that I had eaten at the restaurant, Addiction, and the food was great! I'm a vegetarian and they even specially made my food :) My boyfriend is NOT a vegetarian and he enjoyed his food too. I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: mlara
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay.. Rooms were very clean. Good location. Staff was helpful and friendly. loved all the different options at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding food. Dishonest front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: colesloough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rumor for 3 nights in January. We pre- selected suite 3 months before arrival, confirmed it three different times with hotel management, and when we checked in we DID not get the promised suite.! The excuse given was that current room occupant had decided to stay longer and they could not force em out(they could have had that party switch to the suite they gave us). Lost alot of respect for management there. On the good side: the food was awesome and reasonable..1/2 the price of the more expensive places on strip. Would go there to dine even if we did not stay there. The staff shared the chef is going to appear on the "Top Chef" TV show. No workout room on site but can use Hard Rock fitness facility for $8/day across street. Other thing this hotel needs is a dresser in room to put clothes in. All there is is a small closet with 5 hangers! Everyone complained about that.

Reviews.Title: “Rumor Motel Review”
Reviews.Author: DogsLuvHotels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 2011. Depending on your situation this may or may not be a good choice to stay. This motel is set up for a younger crowd so if you want peace and quiet and very good service this is not the place for you. However if you are ready to party all night long, this is a very fun place to stay. The beds are great, so is the shower and bathroom, some have balconies or patios. The Staff is very young and not knowledgeable at all about the facility so do not expect many questions answered. I would not recommend this property for a husband/wife for leisure unless you are party animals.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged me.....Impossible to get hold of hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: Jenna547
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was very cool and modern. great breakfast! unfortunately, they over charged us, and we have had an impossible time resolving the issue. I called and emailed many times about the matter, and ONLY received a response when I emailed the main manager. Jason was worthless. He was combative, and rude, and I explained that I had called numerous times, and he basically called his staff liars when I knew they weren't. I was there with my husband who is part of the Godsmack tour, and Jason knew this, and still was rude. If Jason is going to treat famous people this way, then beware.....he just does not care. The rest of the staff was amazing, but Jason and his lack of response and care....well, I'll guess I'll be at the Bellagio for the next of my many stays in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “pet friendly night club or hotel? I'm so confused”
Reviews.Author: cordandme
Reviews.Content: I am giving it one star because it allows dogs, the room is ok for the price. Other than that, my experience was not so pleasant at this place. First, let me unveil some hidden policies for you since you won't find them out until you check in. (No, it's not even in the reservation confirmation email) 1. $50 refundable deposit per night - this was not mentioned in the reservation email I received. I wasn't sure if this is for the guests with dogs or everyone else. 2. No outside food and drink - I had to initial my name next to this policy. I was really put off by this policy. I traveled with my dogs. I wouldn't leave them in the room by themselves and I can't bring food and drinks into the hotel? Even though the hotel has a restaurant but what if I am on a special diet? My husband and I had to eat in the car because of this stupid policy. I am sure Westin (also allows dogs) wouldn't mind us eating in the room. 3. $11 a night resort fee - again.. this was not mentioned and I wasn't sure what this was for. I guess to clean up the mess after the guests' dogs make a mess? 4. The room you requested may not b available - this is quite common with other hotels. However, I didn't understand why it is available all of sudden after we insisted to have the room we requested. Besides these hidden policies, my last night there was horrible. They set up a restaurant bar area near the front desk which is 3 rooms down the hallway from where we stayed. During our last night, they had a D.J and a party going all the way to 1 AM. The music was so loud and I couldn't sleep in my room. When I called the front desk, he told me that I could move to a quieter location with bellman's help. It was almost midnight so my choices were either packing up now or suck it up? I have never encountered this type of service in a hotel. I don't know if I checked into a hotel or a night club. I guess if you are into loud music, this is the place for you. Oh yeah, by the way, their WIFI never worked. My 3G network is faster than their WIFI connection. I guess the router was just for the show that "yeah.. we offer WIFI internet... it just never worked or loaded any websites."

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Perfection”
Reviews.Author: amaoricangirl66
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid walking through smoke, casino's and crowds, this is the place for you. From the moment we arrived our experience here has been perfect. The staff is excellent, professional, friendly and are very helpful from sending extra amenities to your room and giving great advice about Las Vegas. The rooms are large, clean, comfortable and have a cool vibe to them. The beds are perfect. The bathroom has a great shower, they furnish you with robes, hair dryers and ample amout of towels. I adore the simplicity of the decor througout the whole hotel. Location is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the strip but again close enough too. We didn't use the pool because it was raining most of our stay but the area surrounding it is well appointed with amazing furniture, great cabana's and is clean, clean, clean. We have stayed at several upscale resorts in this town but I have to say this place is truly a gem and we don't plan on staying anywhere else but here next time we come back. I hope the Rumor Boutique Hotel all the best and nothing but its success!

Reviews.Title: “Best restaurant service ever”
Reviews.Author: 3alix
Reviews.Content: Our party of 15 had made reservations for my daughter's wedding dinner. An error was made in recording the reservation and they were not prepared for our party. The manager Ben interceded and promised to "make it right". And how! He personally took over and waited on us hand and foot, brought the chef out to meet us and saved the day.The meal, service, the setting and the people were awsome. Ben even included a tour of the hotel and it's amenities. We'll be back next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff and THE best pancakes on the planet!!”
Reviews.Author: bashew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days for my birthday, December 7th and 8th. Our Deluxe Suite was beautifully appointed, well maintained, with a huge sunken tub and a super comfy king sized bed. We had a great view of the nicely landscaped courtyard with fun purple hammocks, heated pool and firepits.... great lay out! The staff was friendly and offered great recommendations to restaurants and attractions nearby the property. The icing on the cake is they have a quaint little cafe on site which serves ABSOLUTELY THE BEST PANCAKES I have ever eaten, light , fluffy with an incredibly lucious topping. The only suggestion I would offer is to have a small fridge in the suite. I'm sure the guests would appreciate this added convenience... But, seriously if you would like to stay someplace rrefreshingly different with a chic atmosphere, excellent rates, and off....,but near the beaten path (STRIP), Rumor is the place.

Reviews.Title: “I love boutique hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaydeedubb
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this cute cute cute hotel. Very Palm Springy. Retro, cute, and small. No cigarette smoke filling the air. Cool color scheme. Excellent service. They need to find a good chef. Bar was cute, but service could improve. Met the manager, cool dude. I would most definitely stay here again. Oh, 4 stars for cleanliness because my tub was needed to be cleaned better, which, the maid happily did for me, and the floors could have been better vacumned. I'm sure if I requested the floors to be vacumned they would have been no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying in a typical casino”
Reviews.Author: Just_Passing_Throoo
Reviews.Content: My brother and I were driving from Colorado to California and decided to break up our trip with a quick stop off in Las Vegas. We booked a suite at the Rumor Hotel for a night and decided to stay an additional night. The suite was clean/comfortable, the staff was friendly, and the hotel is located in a very convenient location right across the street from the Hard Rock. All of the standard Vegas attractions are either walking distance or a cheap cab ride away, plus you can head back to Rumor when you want to escape the mob scene at the strip. To get to your room, you walk through a small lobby which opens up to an inviting pool area with private lounges, hammocks suspended over raked sand, and a well manicured lawn. I found this to be a much more enjoyable experience than navigating through a casino floor filled with stale smoke, a sea of blinking slot machines and drunken tourists. At night, Rumor had a cool vibe and was a good place to hang out for a few drinks. Both my brother and I recommend Rumor as a lodging option for either social or business occasions.

Reviews.Title: “RUMOR out did itself”
Reviews.Author: mirendajackson
Reviews.Content: Last night I was at RUMOR and my good friend Nancy hosted her Birthday party there. The room was filled with several event professionals and we all had the best time. Working in the hospitality industry I get the opportunity to work with some of the most hospitable people though RUMOR out did itself last night. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I would especially like to acknowledge Brian at the bar, he did a great job on making sure that drinks were flowing at a steady pace throughout the evening and he always had a smile on his face. Secondly Vince, not sure what his title is but he was the master of it all. Everywhere I turned he was helping to tend the bathrooms (inside and out), moping floors, cleaning the bars, helping people at the front desk, greeting people and cleaning up after folks that couldn't hold a drink in their hands. At one point in the evening we were in need of a tool set for a prop that was brought in and he ran to his car and brought in his own kit. He even assisted in putting it all together. This man is someone who we all wish to have on our team. He was a true team player and helped out where he needed to. Thank you RUMOR for a fun and memorable night. These event professionals will never forget this evening and the superior service that we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to huge strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: Nomad101
Reviews.Content: This trendy little property had alot going for it. Located directly accross from thre Hard Rock hotel, it is a newly renovated 2 story property. Food quite good, and for Las Vegas very reasonable. Has a 24 hour pool. Cheaper rooms are exterior, I suggest going for interior rooms facing the attractive courtyard. We had a junior suite, which while not huge , was fine for 2. Room had a balcony, and the windows openned. While not extravagent, the hotel was nicely done. Bathroom modern but uninspiring, especially for Las Vegas. Staff quite friendly. Only complaint was music that played in the courtyard well into the evening even though most nights there wasn't anyone in the courtyard. $10 cab ride to Venetian. A solid choice. Very nice pool and outdoor furniture. Rates good for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate outdoor presentation but not for families”
Reviews.Author: Rachel3737
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here in Oct with my chn agred 8 & 10. The presentation is immaculate but service and staff need attention. Our beds were not made up when we went to go to bed., you enter thru main lobby , bar area which is not ideal with young children. The room was well presenteed but had NO FRIDGE or DIRECTORY! Asked for two blankets and room service arrived to tell us they only had one in the hotel , so they offered us an extra sheet. Outdoor environment is gorgeous and very inviting (pool and spa area are fantastic) but definately intended for youg party crowd only. Front desk staff not very approachable or knowledgeable and at times made us feel uncomfroatble on enetering and leaving (as if we were not there usual cliente) Valets were great! Sent feedback to General Manager but never received a reply. Hotel was at low occupancy but we were placed in a room with an overwhelming paint/ laquer smell..to the extent both myself and daughter were unwell. Front desk staff couldn't supply info on local area , ie transport or shopping locations etc Great design but staffing and rooms need attention.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good refurbished hotel with lots of little flaws and one big one.”
Reviews.Author: Jillinthebox
Reviews.Content: This is a refurbished hotel that's only been open for a few weeks under it's new name, the Rumor. The location is directly opposite the Hard Rock Hotel so don't believe the other reviews that say it's impossible to get taxis etc, the parking guys will flag you a cab fast. It's only five minutes to the Strip by cab. The rooms are nice, it's certainly not a boutique hotel like it advertises, but it's clean, new, with nice furniture and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in in a hotel. And it has balconies, which is a big bonus for Vegas. There's also free WiFi, another good bonus. There were a couple of little flaws - our wardrobe doors didn't open, there's no tea and coffee or minibar, and our TV signal kept fading. The pool area is really nice, with a pool and spa, comfy lounger beds, and staff on hand to take drinks orders etc. The biggest issue we had was the music. The bar and pool area are right in the centre of the complex, and the hotel pumps dance music out from morning to night. It's impossible to get away from. If you have a hangover and want an afternoon nap, or want a quiet night in after a big party night, you're not going to get it. The music didn't stop til 11pm - ok, understandable for Fri and Sat but not a Sunday when we needed a night off. I had earplugs but the music was so loud they didn't help one bit. Because of the music I have to say I wouldn't stay here again, despite the rest of the experience being pretty good. If you're in town just to party, this would be ideal, except that the bar was empty and everyone obviously went to the Strip to party anyway. I can understand the idea behind the music but surely they should understand even young guests need a bit of silence sometimes?

Reviews.Title: “Huge potential, didn't really deliver”
Reviews.Author: KMKTraveller
Reviews.Content: First of all, rooms at newly opened Rumor are simply gorgeous - classy, beautiful, comfy, clean, actually one of the nicest we've stayed in. The pool area is very pretty (but was deserted our whole stay; we hardly saw other guests at all). However, there are also a few negatives and all in all I don't think I would choose Rumor again. The front staff felt very young and lacked a bit in professionality. Also it seemed their booking system wasn't working too well - we had to correct the price both at check-in and check-out, and still got a tiny bit overcharged (which they, however, promptly corrected when we pointed that out). And, importantly, Rumor is quite far from the Strip; it takes at least 15 minutes to walk, in the desert heat, so taxi bills add up. If you're new to Vegas, try to stay on the Strip instead, it's more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyR
Reviews.Content: Just ask and I will tell u about it. I is so much fun and there are always beautiful people around.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Sexy however...”
Reviews.Author: StarChina
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby I thought I was in Heaven. From the decor to the cleanliness I knew I saved the best hotel for last during our 8 day stay. The staff (especially Brendan, Dave and Cailey - sorry if I got the spelling wrong) were personable, friendly and just wanted I needed after staying at two of the "bigger" properties. The drinks at the bar (especially the Cucumber Collins) were delicious and priced just right. The breakfast at Addiction was just like home (and I'm a good cook). I had the waffles with bacon mixed in and topped with peanut butter and maple syrup- I was on vacation after all. The hotel was exactly as I expected - a chic boutique hotel. I can't even begin to describe how lovely the pool area is. The weather was in the high 80's but hardly anyone was in the pool. I felt like we had it all to ourselves. The only downside was the Housekeeping. The first day our bed never got made at all. The 3 nights we stayed no one ever vacuumed the bedroom/living room area. We had to ask for an iron and ironing board (which I found rather odd). The only other downside was that they have no magnifying mirrors - it was a bit difficult to put on make-up (especially at night). Other than that I would definitely stay again, especially at the end of a trip. It felt like we were enough away from the Strip for the "quiet" aspect (we could walk across the street to the Hard Rock if we wanted to gamble) but only a two minute ride (10 minute walk) if we wanted to get to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “great value, hip, clean hotel, fantastic pool area, still a few operational snafus”
Reviews.Author: LovePeonies
Reviews.Content: Hip, imaginative updated hotel. Great friendly staff. I went there for a 4-day conference and wanted to stay just off the strip. Must say I felt welcomed and well cared for by the staff. Staff, although still new (hotel had been open 9 weeks), is very friendly, helpful and thorough. There were some operational snafus but the genuine concern and quick rectifying of problems turned potential lemons into lemonade. I'd stay there again in a NY second. The beds are very comfortable with real down pillows, both a rain shower and the large in-room tub are great. Robes are comfortable, maid service is great. Pool area is hip and beautiful with white cabanas and totally mod furniture. Check out the 3-chocolate purple M&Ms at the front desk. They had lost my reservation, the hot water went out the first night I was there and there were no vegetables in the kitchen when I asked for a late dinner. However, they honoured the reservation, called the chief engineer at 1 in the morning to fix the hot water problem (he did) and found 2 large sweet potatoes for dinner (at a very reasonable price). From David the doorman to Hailey to all the staff, they worked to make sure my stay was the best it could possibly be. It takes time to get everyone trained at a new hotel and to get all the systems in good working order. These guys are working hand. I'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star South Beach hotel in the middle of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BradyBerk
Reviews.Content: There is no other hotel like this one in Vegas. If you like South Beach or Palm Springs, you will be in heaven. The decor is the sexiest in Vegas....hands down. The lounge and restaurant is a perfect gathering spot for cocktails. I didn't get a chance to try the food but the menu looked top notch. In regards to food/beverage, I would recommend you grab some soft drinks from the CVS across the street b/c the vending machine was broken. The maid service did much more than I expected and actually tried to come back multiple times since I was sleeping in. I took pictures of the bathroom because we decided we wanted to rennovate our bathroom at home just like the ones at Rumor. The pool wasn't crowded which was relaxing and the music was exactly what we look for while on vacation (we get sick of hearing the same radio songs over and over....the music reminded me of being at a modern 5 star spa). I am suggesting this resort to my best friend for her wedding. The courtyard is ideal for a 150 room hotel wedding. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: bd9902
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Saturday and Sunday night. Location is okay, on Harmon across from Hard Rock. It appears as though parking is valet only, which is fine, but if you're cabbing it, you might have a wait. I never saw a cab outside the hotel the entire time I was there. Check in was easy and quick. The hotel is two levels with several different buildings connected via outside walkways. I booked a king suite with pool view and I think I ended up with a king suite with pool view and spa tub. Very cool room, it's a true suite with a balcony (the rooms on the 1st floor have a patio, 2nd floor have balconies) which overlooked the courtyard, which is beautiful. The room is huge, with a small table and chairs and a large leather (?) couch in the sitting room and a big bed and huge tub in the bedroom. The bathroom is also big, which a nice shower with a rain head. Free WiFi too! The only issue I had was with the air conditioner remote control. I could never figure it out, but both units in the room were blowing out cold air, so I let it be. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay but improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: pernilla_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rumor three nights 20-23d of August. Pros- got an upgrade to a two room suite Really nice pool area open 24hours and nice room interior design Cons- Loud music from the pool during the weekend nite. The jacuzzi/hot tub in the room did not work, apparantely none of the hot tubs did, why not inform about that? We actually paid extra for a hot tub.. Cleaning- they did not clean our room one day. Reason? It was Sunday and we were told at the reception that there was a lot of dirty rooms to take care of after the weekend. We arrived on a friday and the hot tub was dirty and one of the drinking glasses were so dirty that it is impossible to miss. We booked one nite, get one free but it didn´t get through the website so we sent an email without getting an answer. The second time they would fix it if we spoke to the reception staff at the arrival. We did that but when we got the bill it wasn´t taken care of. It took two more bills before it was corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: USUAggie
Reviews.Content: This stylish property makes you feel like you are at a South Beach or Palm Springs spa...not a crowded, loud casino. Just a short cab ride from the airport (about $15 with tip) gets you to the place. Don't believe the Expedia site that says they have a complimentary shuttle...or coffee maker. If you are driving, you valet your car (free parking, but the cute and friendly valets live off your tips). The lobby is ultra modern with a bar to the left (check out the funky lighting and the pig statures). There is a restaurant in the lobby area as well. We did not eat there, but one of the security guards said the filet mignon sliders are to die for (his exact words). Our room faced the Hard Rock Hotel which was fine for us. You might want to ask for a room that faces the inner court and pool area. The room was large and had a sitting area. Some rooms are larger and have large soaking tubs. Our room had a very nice bathroom with a glass, rain head shower and large raised bowl sink. If purple is your color, you will love the color scheme. Purple...Purple...Purple. The real deal here is the pool. One large pool, one shallow soaking pool with spraying water features and a large jacuzzi (which we didn't use since it was 107 degrees the days we were there). If you get to the pool early, snag a cabana and enjoy the pool with a bit of shade for cover. All day the friendly bar staff provide pool service. Since this hotel is for adults, the day at the pool is free of screaming kids and surly teens (have both, so it was nice for a few days not to hear screaming kids and deal with surly teens). The crowd seemed to be mixed with mostly young couples, a few singles and a few older couples. The music at the pool was not too loud and did not make you feel like you were at a nightclub. This all changes when this property is booked for a party I am sure! The front desk and business manager fixed an issue we had booking the hotel through Expedia (which we got for around 50 bucks a night). If you sign-up on the Rumor website they will send you upcoming deals. My only negative is the AC in the room was very loud (but at 107 degrees not going to complain too much). If you are looking for a relaxing place with a great pool and some style, this is your place. If you are looking for a mega-resort with crowds and loud casino bells walk across the street to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, relaxing, great views of the pool area">)”
Reviews.Author: Payneman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. I had a basic King bed, sauna shower for about 50 bucks a night. The grounds were extraordinarily clean and the lobby was an explosion of color and style. The covered gazebos by the pool and Jacuzzi were just the right touch for the shade seekers. The bar was small but inviting, plenty of cushy couches and pillows to lounge on while you sip you "Black Orchid" Derek, was a “Master” bartender and Ed at security made everyone that walked by feel welcome. The Hard Rock café is 60 paces across the street for the gamblers and show goers. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I have found a new place to stay in Vegas. This hotel only takes guests over 18 which I love. An Adult hotel…who would have “thunk it”. E. E. P.

Reviews.Title: “The best of boutique style, a mini Miami in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: keytouch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend, paid on average $50 a night through one of the comparison sites. Hotel was gorgeous, from the lobby to the rooms. The central garden and pool area was divine. Staff here are great. The free valet parking was a nice treat, and all staff were lovely. Particularly worthy of a mention was Shaughn, one of the reception staff, always a friendly smile and chat, offered good locality advice and even personally delivered fresh towels to the room at 1am. One of the best features is the pool area, deck chairs, outside beds and cabanas all included, lovely size pool and good size hot tub. And the best thing, the pool is open 24 hours. And with the heat Vegas can get to, you'd be surprised how welcoming a 2am swim can be when you get back from the strip. Location for me was perfect. I wanted to be off strip, however this hotel was not too far away. Only 20 mins walk down to the strip and the MGM and the Bellagio. Or if you want to hop in a cab the fare is only about $6 Overall, loved our stay and look forward to returning here again. ...... and the purple M&M's at reception are delicious... it's the little touches that count.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back...”
Reviews.Author: mevans2001
Reviews.Content: Due to our busy schedules we have not been able to take our annual vacation so we decided to stay in town and check out Rumor. From the moment we walked in the lobby decorated in all white with unique art work was like a spot right out of Miami. Stephan at the front desk greeted us with a warm smile and checked us in quickly. I had the pleasure of meeting Rob the GM not your typical GM he was friendly yes that's right friendly, he sat down and spoke with us for a while he mingled with guest and I even saw him clear dishes off a table. With that attitude alone you should check the place out. Our room was nicely decorated with a upscale modern decor. When I opened the curtains one morning I honestly forgot I was in Vegas it reminded me so much of the Caribbean; sand, grass, palm trees and hammocks. It was great! We had dinner at the restaurant Chef Vic is crazy amazing with his food. You have to try the short ribs with candied yams, sliders, sticky chicky, fried Mac and cheese. Not only is the food amazing the service Chef Vic and Paul gave was phenomenal. We have found our new local get away. Congrats to the entire Rumor family. FYI...you have access to the gym at Hard Rock.

HotelInfo.Name: Rumor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 455 E. Harmon Ave., Las Vegas, NV 89169
